0.title: Providing additional state minimum salary for certain teachers
0.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an additional $5,000 in state minimum salary to fully certified math and science teachers who teach in these subjects in grades seven through 12 and to certified reading specialists.

1.title: Changing the time for periodic valuations and assessments of real and personal property
1.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the time for periodic valuations and assessments of real and personal property from every three years to every five years and provide a 10% cap on any increase in assessment in any one year.

2.title: Authorizing paid municipal fire departments to investigate suspicious or illegal fires
2.description: The purpose of this bill is to  authorize paid municipal fire departments to investigate suspicious or illegal fires and to gather evidence at scenes of suspicious or illegal fires set or existing in or around public rights-of-way or otherwise within a municipality.

3.title: Establishing a program for reprogramming cellular telephones and distributing to seniors for making emergency calls
3.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a program for collecting cellular telephones to be reprogrammed and distributed to seniors without cellular phones for making emergency calls.

4.title: Requiring schools to post and make available to the public the schedules of teachers and staff
4.description: The purpose of this bill is to require every school to post and make available to the public the schedule for every teacher and staff personnel for each school, and if a school fails to do so, the principal of that school and the county superintendent of that school shall be fined $500.00   each.

5.title: Requiring color coded certificates of insurance to be placed on the windshield of the insured motor vehicle
5.description: The purpose of this bill is to require color coded certificates of insurance to be placed on the windshield of the insured motor vehicle and to provide penalties for violations of this section.

6.title: Reducing the federal adjusted gross income for motor fuel expenses incurred in commuting to and from one's occupation
6.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a modification in the state personal income tax by reducing the federal adjusted gross income for motor fuel expenses incurred in commuting to and from one's occupation at the mileage rate allowed at the federal income tax level by the federal Internal Revenue Service.

7.title: Defining "the deceased" for purposes of prescribing that a deceased victim includes unborn children under first and second degree murder
7.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "the deceased" for purposes of prescribing that a deceased victim includes unborn children under first and second degree murder.

8.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
8.title: Business and occupation tax credit to electric power generators for the use of West Virginia coal
8.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a business and occupation tax credit to electric power generators for the use of each ton of coal mined in West Virginia by "small mining operations."

9.title: Budget Bill, making appropriations of public money out of the treasury in accordance with section fifty-one, article six of the Constitution

10.title: Providing correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service
10.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers may retire with full benefits after 20 years of actual and honorable service.

11.title: Relating to assessments of real property
11.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit increases in the assessed value of real property which is located in a county where a maximum excess levy is in effect, the property has not changed in tax classification and the increased value is more than 2 percent over the assessed value of the same property for the previous year.

12.title: Increasing salary increments paid to principals and assistant principals
12.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase salary increments paid to principals and assistant principals.

13.title: Eliminating the severance tax and the health care provider tax on behavior health providers
13.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the severance tax and health care provider tax on behavior health providers.

14.title: Creating the criminal offense of injury to a pregnant woman that results in miscarriage or stillbirth
14.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a new criminal offense based on acts of violence against a pregnant woman that result in a miscarriage or stillbirth of her fetus.

15.title: Providing for removal and election of Public Service Commissioners
15.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the election and removal of Public Service Commissioners, setting terms of office for said commissioners,  and otherwise relating to the Public Service Commission.

16.title: Authorizing and encouraging county boards of education to share services of central office administrative personnel
16.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize and encourage county boards of education to share services of central office administrative personnel and to obtain these services from regional education service agencies.

17.title: Making the destruction of a landlord's property which has been rented for residential purposes a criminal offense
17.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a criminal offense for the destruction of a landlord's property which has been rented for residential purposes.  The bill provides that damage greater than $300.00 but less than $1,000.00 may constitute a misdemeanor while providing that damage greater than $1000.00 may constitute a felony.  Failure to remove trash upon vacating a leasehold is also designated as a criminal offense if the landlord is required to expend more than $100.00 to remove it.  It further provides as follows:  That damage deposits be used to offset ascertainment of value of damage; that a finding of prima facie evidence under certain circumstances may be made; and that tenants or others in privity of contract with landlords or lessors have a duty to report damage not caused by themselves while additionally, providing a criminal penalty for failure to report such damage under certain circumstances.  This reporting requirement takes into consideration the tenant or other person's right against self-incrimination to the extent it does not require the tenant or other person to report damage caused by themselves.

18.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
18.title: Prohibiting employees at restaurants from handling drinking vessels by touching on or near the vessel's brim
18.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit employees at restaurants from handling drinking vessels by physically handling the drinking vessels on or near the vessel's brim.

19.title: Exempting children receiving an exemption from compulsory school attendance in favor of church school from standardized testing requirement
19.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize an exemption from standardized testing for children receiving an exemption from compulsory school attendance who attend church school.   The actual intent of the bill is to provide an exemption for Amish children, but due to Constitutional concerns, Amish children are not specifically singled out for the exemption, and other religious groups could also theoretically apply for and be granted the exemption.  The draft cites the United States Supreme Court decision of Wisconsin v. Yoder as precedent for the exemption. This court case involved a successful Amish challenge to Wisconsin law providing for compulsory school attendance.

20.title: Giving the Insurance Commissioner the power to regulate and penalize self-insured employers
20.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Insurance Commissioner the power to regulate and penalize self-insured employers in order to combat the practice of employers neglecting to pay benefits offered under their self-insured plans, resulting in unpaid medical bills which negatively impacts employees' credit ratings.

21.title: Relating to the investigation and prosecution of cases involving child abuse and neglect
21.description: The purpose of this bill is to aid in the investigation and prosecution of cases involving child abuse and neglect. In any case where a multidisciplinary investigative team suspects an uncooperative parent, guardian, or custodian of child abuse, the Department of Health and Human Resources would be authorized to take temporary protective custody of the child in order to safely conduct a team interview with the child at a child advocacy center.

22.title: Providing all persons convicted of a felony are subject to DNA testing
22.description: The purpose of this bill requires that all persons convicted of any felony offense who reside in this state must submit to DNA testing.  The bill leaves intact provisions which require DNA testing for certain misdemeanor convictions.

23.title: Reducing staff development programs for school personnel from eighteen hours to twelve hours
23.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce staff development programs for school personnel from 18 hours to 12 hours; and requiring that the six hour reduction in staff development be used as an additional preparation day.

24.title: Including bicycle and pedestrian ways in consideration in the planning and development of state roads
24.description: The purpose of this bill is to include bicycle and pedestrian ways in consideration in the planning and development of state roads.  It provides that bicycle and pedestrian ways shall be established in conjunction with the construction, reconstruction or other changes of any state road, with special emphasis to projects in or within one mile of an urban area.

25.title: Eliminating penalties associated with the underpayment of taxes owed from a person who is a resident individual, provided a personal income tax is timely filed
25.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate penalties associated with the underpayment of taxes owed from a person who is a resident individual, provided a personal income tax is timely filed and payment of any tax due is made at that time.

26.title: Creating an excise tax on methadone
26.description: The purpose of this bill is to mandate that opioid treatment centers remain open seven days a week including holidays in order to eliminate any methadone being sent home with patients.

27.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
27.title: Providing that when any body part of an unborn child is outside the womb, the child is born, and is considered a citizen of the state
27.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that when any body part of an unborn child is outside the mother's womb, the child is born, and is considered a citizen of the state with same rights and privileges under the law as any other citizen.

28.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
28.title: Ensuring that medical workers have the right to refuse to participate in any abortion-related activity
28.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that medical workers have the right to refuse to participate in any abortion-related activity without fear of disciplinary action or dismissal.  The bill also prescribes a criminal fine for violations of the section.

29.title: Providing a three percent cap on any increase in assessment on real property that is the primary residence
29.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a three percent cap on any increase in assessment on real property that is the primary residence of an individual in any one year.

30.title: Permitting firework displays on public school property provided the State Superintendent and the Fire Marshal approve the display
30.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit firework displays on public school property provided the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshall approve the display.

31.title: Removing the section of code that limits the use of certain types of vehicles on highways between sunset and sunrise
31.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove a section of code that limits the use of certain types of exempted vehicles on highways between sunrise and sunset.

32.title: Including a parenting plan with an application for a marriage license
32.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a parenting plan to be included with an application for a marriage license.

33.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
33.title: Relating to the eliminating of mercury in vaccines
33.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate, to the maximum extent possible, the use of vaccines that contain mercury.

34.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
34.title: Requiring a woman, prior to an abortion, to have a pregnancy test administered at the facility where the abortion is to be performed
34.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a woman, prior to an abortion, to have a pregnancy test administered at the facility where the abortion is to be performed, and the pregnancy test results must be confirmed prior to the abortion.  The bill also provides that the license of a physician may be revoked for violations.

35.title: Eliminating West Virginia income tax on social security benefits
35.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate West Virginia income tax on social security benefits.

36.title: Relating to requirements for PROMISE scholarships
36.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide West Virginia students with a partial PROMISE scholarship for schooling outside the state for the reason that no in-state institution offers a course for a major or a degree in the desired field; and to require applicants and recipients of PROMISE scholarships to perform community services.

37.title: Uniform Premarital Agreement Act
37.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Uniform Premarital Agreement Act.  This act allows parties to a marriage to contract prior to marriage with respect to property rights, actions to be taken upon dissolution of the marriage, rights to insurance proceeds upon death of either party, choice of controlling law and any other matters not in violation of criminal statutes or public policy.  Child support cannot be adversely affected.

38.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
38.title: Establishing the Consent to Health Care of Minors Act
38.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Consent to Health Care of Minors Act, allowing for a caregiver who is not a parent, legal custodian or guardian of a minor to consent to health care for a minor through an affidavit.  The bill provides for revocation and termination of consent, good faith reliance on the affidavit, exceptions to an affidavit's applicability, penalties for a false statement in an affidavit of consent, and rule-making authority.

39.title: Relating to when a recognizance bond is released
39.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a recognizance secured by execution of a bail bond is void upon the finding that the accused person is guilty, and to terminate bond liability at that time.

40.title: Exempting the retirement benefits of certain annuitants under the State Teachers Retirement System from state income tax
40.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the retirement benefits of certain annuitants under the State Teachers Retirement System from state income tax.

41.title: Providing a tax credit for Ad Valorem tax paid on Manufacturing Inventory
41.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a  tax credit for ad valorem tax paid on manufacturing inventory, and other tangible personal property which will reduce either or both the amount of business franchise tax or corporate net income tax owed , effective the tax year beginning July 1, 2009.

42.title: Relating to notification of cancellation or nonrenewal of an insured's automobile liability insurance contract or policy
42.description: The purpose of this bill is to require an insured whose automotive liability insurance contract or policy has been canceled or not renewed to provide proof of valid insurance for a vehicle covered under the recently canceled or nonrenewed policy within 30 days upon notice from the West Virginia Division  of Motor Vehicles.

43.title: Including Salem International University as an eligible institution and modifying provisions regarding eligible higher education institutions receiving PROMISE scholarship funds
43.description: The purpose of this bill is to include Salem International University as an eligible institution and modifies provisions regarding the higher education institutions that are eligible to continue to receive PROMISE scholarship funds.

44.title: Relating to funeral and cremation expenses for indigent persons
44.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize cremation of indigent persons by funeral directors and the payment of this service by the Department of Health and Human Resources.

45.title: Enabling creditors to collect upon their judgements from debtors who often attempt to defeat such judgments
45.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable creditors to collect upon their judgments from debtors who often attempt to defeat such judgments by disappearing.  It also protects a certain class of persons whose identity and location must not be revealed due to court orders.

46.title: Providing that alleged victims of domestic violence or abuse have the right to have a person of their choosing present when they are interviewed by law-enforcement officers or the prosecuting attorney
46.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that alleged victims of domestic violence or abuse have the right to have a person of their choosing present when they are interviewed by law-enforcement officers or the prosecuting attorney.

47.title: Providing for the continuance of medical coverage for the spouse of a deceased retired public employee for any period previously purchased with accumulated leave
47.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the continuance of medical coverage for the spouse of a deceased retired employee for any period previously purchased with accumulated leave.

48.title: Providing that a legally unlicensed personal care home may house up to four unrelated residents if there is at least one full-time employee working at the home
48.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a legally unlicensed personal care home may house up to four unrelated residents if there is at least one full-time employee working at the home.

49.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
49.title: Expanding the counties covered by West Virginia Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority to include Cabell, Mason and Jackson counties; and increasing the number of members
49.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of members on the West Virginia Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority from 20 to 26 and expand the Authority's territory to include Cabell, Mason and Jackson counties.

50.title: Providing a two thousand eight dollar salary increase for each employee of the Division of Corrections
50.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $2,008.00 salary increase for every employee of the Division of Corrections.

51.title: Prohibiting a person convicted of any felony from holding public office
51.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit convicted felons from holding public office.

52.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
52.title: Prohibiting pharmacists and other persons involved in dispensing medicines from refusing to fill prescriptions
52.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit pharmacists and other persons involved in dispensing medicines from refusing to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance without a valid reason.  It provides for complaints to the Board of Pharmacy and a civil cause of action.

53.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
53.title: Providing a mechanism whereby unused, unexpired nonnarcotic drugs previously owned by a deceased nursing home patient or resident may be donated to free health care clinics in the state
53.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mechanism whereby unused, unexpired nonnarcotic drugs previously owned by a deceased nursing home patient or resident may be donated to free health care clinics in the state, provided that the family of the deceased patient or resident has given consent for the donation.

54.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
54.title: Requiring nursing homes to publicly post staffing information and granting rights to family councils
54.description: The purpose of this bill is to require nursing homes to publicly post staffing information and to, additionally, grant certain rights to family councils.  It requires nursing homes to post, each shift, the names of licensed and unlicensed staff with direct care responsibilities. It establishes the type of information to be provided and the manner in which it must be posted.  The bill grants privacy and organizational rights to family councils and requires nursing homes to respond to a council's concerns and questions regarding facility administrative decisions which affect the lives of residents in the facility.  The bill also sets forth resident?s rights violations while including civil penalties for noncompliance.

55.title: Relating to electronic and paper requisition format approved by the Auditor
55.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the Auditor may set standards for archiving electronic and paper documents related to requisitions.

56.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
56.title: Requiring the department of health and human resources to enforce specific abortion clinic regulations
56.description: The purpose of this bill is to   require the Department of Health and Human Resources to enforce specific abortion clinic regulations. The bill also prescribes a criminal fine for violations of the section.

57.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
57.title: No State-Funded Transportation for Abortion Act
57.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that neither the state nor any county may reimburse any person or entity for transporting any person to schedule, arrange or procure an abortion.

58.title: Prohibiting certain sex offenders from loitering within one thousand feet of a school or child care facility, school bus stop, or other child safety zone
58.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain sex offenders from loitering within 1,000 feet of a school or child care facility, school bus stop, or other child safety zone.

59.title: Requiring magistrate courts to maintain records relating to successful collection rates on judgements
59.description: The purpose of this bill is to require magistrate courts to maintain records relating to successful collection rates on judgments and to make reports of these available to claimants and general public.

60.title: Prohibiting abusive behavior towards elephants by an owner or manager
60.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor for an owner or manager of an elephant to engage in abusive behavior towards the elephant.

61.title: Giving the owners of newly constructed homes a ten-year grace period before a connection to a newly installed sewer line is mandatory
61.description: The purpose of this bill is to give owners of newly constructed homes a 10 year grace period before a connection to a newly installed sewer line is mandatory, provided the home is not sold within that 10 year period.

62.title: Relating to water utility rates
62.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a water utility to charge low income consumers reduced rates and to recover any resulting decrease in revenues from the utility's other customers.

63.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
63.title: Designating the seventh day of December, "Pearl Harbor Day," as a legal state holiday
63.description: The purpose of this bill is to designate December, 7 "Pearl Harbor Day," as a legal state holiday.

64.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
64.title: Relating to issuing a certificate of birth resulting in stillbirth
64.description: The purpose of "Kirstin's bill" is to provide for the issuance by the State Registrar of a Certificate of Birth Resulting in Stillbirth to parents of a stillborn who request the record to be prepared.

65.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
65.title: Prohibiting fractional pricing in the retail sale of gasoline
65.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit fractional pricing in the retail sale of gasoline and to define such pricing as an unfair or deceptive practice.

66.title: Allowing a tax deduction for all prepaid tuition contracts or college savings plan
66.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a tax deduction for all prepaid tuition contracts or college savings plan regardless of whether they are administered by the board of the college prepaid tuition and savings program.

67.title: Excluding federal interest income when applying the income exclusion available to those sixty-five years of age or older and to persons permanently and totally disabled
67.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude federal interest income when applying $8,000.00 income exclusion available to persons age 65 or older and to persons who are permanently and totally disabled regardless of age and making the change retroactive to tax years beginning after December 31, 2000.

68.title: Increasing the faculty senate allotment for classroom teachers and librarians
68.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the faculty senate allotment for classroom teachers and librarians from $50 to $100, to be spent on academic materials, supplies or equipment to enhance instruction.

69.title: Requiring that all worker's compensation adjusters employed by a private insurance carrier be located within the geographic borders of West Virginia
69.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve claimants' access to worker's compensation adjusters by requiring that all worker's compensation adjusters employed by a private insurance carrier be located within the geographic borders of West Virginia.

70.title: Prohibiting discrimination in rates by insurance companies because of having filed claims under the uninsured and under  insured coverage of an automobile policy
70.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit discrimination in rates by insurance companies because of having filed claims under the uninsured and under insured coverage of an automobile insurance policy.

71.title: Relating to variable premium adjustable life insurance policies
71.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require insurance companies who provide variable premium adjustable life insurance polices to issue annual statements which include information related to how long a particular policy will remain in force under specific circumstances related to the payment and nonpayment of premiums relative to any  existing principal amount accumulated for investment purposes under the policy.

72.title: Requiring that abortion providers notify the parents of a minor seeking an abortion forty-eight hours before performing the procedure
72.description: The purpose of this bill is to require forty-eight hours notice to the parents of a minor seeking an abortion before performing the abortion.

73.title: Requiring that certain records maintained by the clerk of the county commission to be preserved
73.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require that certain records maintained by the clerk of the county commission to be preserved, and to remove the statute of limitations on certain personal actions.

74.title: Allowing family court judges to carry concealed deadly weapons without obtaining a license
74.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow family court judges to carry a concealed deadly weapon without obtaining a license.

75.title: Making it unlawful to offer for sale or sell products created wholly or in part by county or regional jail inmates
75.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it unlawful to sell or offer to sell products made with inmate labor.

76.title: Adding a magistrate to those serving Putnam County
76.description: The purpose of this bill is to add a magistrate to those serving Putnam County.

77.title: Notifying persons from out-of-state who issue worthless checks in this state and who, fail to pay the check and applicable fine or fail to appear in court, that a notice of their failure will be sent to the Division of Motor Vehicles
77.description: The purpose of this bill is to notify persons residing out-of-state who write worthless checks in this state and who after being served with a summons upon a worthless check complaint fail to pay the check  and applicable fine or fail to make an appearance in magistrate court, that a notice of their failure will be forwarded to the Division of Motor Vehicles to be dealt with in accordance with existing law.

78.title: Providing that when a person from another state writes a worthless check in this state which results in a summons to appear in magistrate court but then fails to appear shall have his or her privilege to drive in this state revoked
78.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that when a person from another state writes a worthless check in this state which results in a summons to appear in magistrate court but then fails to appear, the person shall have his or her privilege to drive in this state revoked.  The bill also provides that the Division of Motor Vehicles mail notice of the revocation to the state wherein the person who wrote the bad check holds a driver's license.

79.title: Providing a ten percent discount to residents at state parks and forests
79.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a ten percent discount to West Virginia residents for lodging, camping and other recreation activities at state parks and forests.

80.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
80.title: Requiring the superintendent or owner of a mine to sign the fire boss record book daily
80.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the superintendent or owner-operator of the mine to sign the fire boss record book each day along with the mine foreman.

81.title: Providing criminal penalties for negligently or carelessly shooting and wounding or killing a human being while hunting under the influence of alcohol or drugs
81.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide criminal penalties for negligently or carelessly shooting and wounding or killing a human being while hunting under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

82.title: Relating to disclosure requirements for political campaign advertisements
82.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide disclosure requirements for political campaign advertisements.  The bill also provides criminal penalties and civil remedies.

83.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
83.title: Small Business Development Incentive Program for Internal Growth Act
83.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the "Small Business Development Incentive Program for Internal Growth Act." The bill exempts certain small businesses from paying business-related taxes if they qualify as start up businesses with limited resources.

84.title: Providing county boards of education may study the economic feasibility of exercising an option of engaging in cooperative agreements with local public or regional transit authorities to transport students
84.description: The purpose of this bill is to  provide that county boards of education may, in cooperation with local public or regional transit authorities study the feasibility of entering into cooperative agreements to transport  students to and from school. The bill also requires that county boards submit proposed cooperative agreements to the Department of Transportation for approval prior to implementation.  In addition, the bill requires county boards to submit reports to the Legislatures' Joint Committee on Government and Finance on the cost-effectiveness of cooperative agreements that have been implemented.  Under the bill, the Secretary of Transportation is required to propose legislative rules to be used as guidelines for approval of proposed cooperative agreements.

85.title: Providing a five percent personal income tax reduction
85.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a five percent tax reduction to all personal income tax rates.

86.title: Changing the definition of final average salary to thirty-six consecutive months for calculating retirement
86.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the definition of final average salary to 36 consecutive months rather than five consecutive years for calculating retirement.

87.title: Providing for the temporary detention of criminal suspects by law-enforcement officers where probable cause appears to exist
87.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the temporary detention of criminal suspects by law-enforcement officers to inquire on commission of a crime where probable cause appears to exist.

88.title: Allowing certain public employees to pay back retirement benefits
88.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow public employees with 15 or more years' service who were subject to reduction in force layoffs to pay back retirement benefits they cashed out of the Public Employees Retirement System.

89.title: Providing a housing supplement for members of the State Police
89.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a housing supplement for members of the State Police.

90.title: Requiring public notice of state plan amendments prior to submission and increasing the membership of the Medicaid Advisory Board
90.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require public notice of state plan amendments prior to submission for federal approval and increasing the membership of the Medicaid Advisory Board.

91.title: Prohibiting inquiries reflected on a credit report from adversely affecting an application for insurance
91.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of a credit score to banking institution credit scoring for casualty insurance rate filings; to prohibit the use of credit scoring as a consideration in calculating insurance rates in homeowners or automobile liability policies; and to prohibit the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance; and, prohibiting reliance on information which is false or potentially false.

92.title: Providing a framework to avoid imposition of policies and practices on the public schools that distract from a thorough and efficient education
92.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a framework to avoid imposition of policies and practices on the public schools that distract from the education process.  The bill contains the following provisions in furtherance of its primary purpose, as aforesaid:  (1) It makes findings and expresses legislative intent; (2) it requires the use of fiscal notes on policies, rules and programs affecting public schools which outline applicable costs; (3) it provides alternative conditions under which policies, rules and programs may be adopted; and (4) it provides for an audit of capacity to implement certain past policies, rules and programs as well as requiring the issuance of a report of recommendations.

93.title: Prohibiting employees of higher education from assisting students in securing abortions
93.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit employees of higher education from assisting students in securing abortions.

94.title: Faculty Excellence Act
94.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Faculty Excellence Act."  Under the act, legislative goals are set for faculty at state colleges and universities with specific ratios to be met by 2013.  In addition, the bill provides that each institution of higher education establish a  "Faculty Restoration and Equity Fund"  for legislative appropriations aimed at providing the resources necessary to accomplish the goals of the act.

95.title: Requiring the subject of physics as a required course in all public secondary schools for graduation
95.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the teaching of physics in all public secondary schools of this state as a required course for graduation.

96.title: Permitting deed of trust or mortgage interest paid on a taxpayers' personal residences to be used for personal income tax purposes
96.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit deed of trust or mortgage interest paid on taxpayers' personal residences to be used for personal income tax purposes.

97.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
97.title: Prohibiting oil and gas operators from daylighting
97.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit oil and gas drillers from "daylighting" the roads and sites they build by cutting down timber in wide swaths of both sides of the road or site.  An exception can be made by rule by the Office of Oil and Gas if the exception is based on scientific studies.  Also the bill increases the compensation a surface owner receives from the driller for using the surface owner's land for well road and well sites if the driller places the road or site in places the surface owner did not want unless it was necessary for the driller to place the road and site where it was placed.

98.title: Exempting wrecker services from regulation by the Public Service Commission
98.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt wrecker services from regulation by the Public Service Commission.

99.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
99.title: Relating to treatment for drug and alcohol addiction
99.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a system of extended involuntary treatment for persons addicted to drugs and alcohol.  Under the bill, only the parents, a close relative or a friend may file the petition for involuntary commitment.  In addition, the petitioner is responsible for the payment of treatment costs.  Currently, there is a procedure for involuntary commitment of a person who is addicted to alcohol and drugs, and as a result are a danger to self or others.  Under that procedure, a person may be released without undergoing an effective and comprehensive drug and alcohol treatment program.  This bill allows families to ensure that a family member will receive that involuntary extended drug and alcohol abuse treatment.

100.title: Providing for a credit against the West Virginia personal income tax liability in the amount of payments made on student loans
100.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a credit against West Virginia personal income tax liability in the amount of payments made on student loans.

101.title: Changing the qualifier for low income for a senior citizens' homestead tax credit
101.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the qualifier for low income to 250% or less of the federal poverty guideline from 150% or less of the federal poverty guideline for a senior citizens' homestead tax credit.

102.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
102.title: Relating to drug and alcohol free mines
102.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a comprehensive drug and alcohol free program for miners.  Mine operators are eligible for a credit on their Workers' Compensation premiums if they have established a drug and alcohol free mine workplace as provided in the bill.  The bill requires proof of drug and alcohol free status in order for miners to be certified.  Mine inspectors are required to receive training in drug and alcohol abuse and a statewide database of miners failing to provide proof of alcohol and drug free status is established.  Criminal penalties are also provided in the bill for violations.

103.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
103.title: Providing benefits for those who have served in the military service
103.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide rewards to those serving in the military by providing service credits, for purposes of public employment retirement, for service in any branch of the military including the West Virginia National Guard and Reserve; and providing additional testing credit points in civil service examinations for members of the National Guard and Reserve who are applying for state employment.

104.title: Relating to prohibiting legislators from enrolling in the state retirement system
104.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit legislators from enrolling in the state retirement system while providing legislators may elect to direct contributions deducted for retirement pensions into self-directed 401(K) pension plans.

105.title: Making English the official language of West Virginia
105.description: The purpose of this bill is to make English the official state language.

106.title: Providing a method in which males may contest allegations or presumptions of biological parentage under certain circumstances
106.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a method in which males may contest allegations or presumptions of biological parentage under certain circumstances.

107.title: Prohibiting the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project for a living elected public official
107.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit  the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project which receives any operating or construction moneys from state sources or state taxpayers   for a living, elected official by any governmental entity.  The bill also provides that any responsible governmental official authorizing the naming of a building, road, structure or project for a living elected official is liable to the governmental entity for any costs incurred by a violation.

108.title: Increasing the West Virginia retirement income exemption from taxation on persons age sixty-five years of age or older or surviving spouse of such persons
108.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the exemption on retirement income from taxation on persons age 65 years of age or older or a surviving spouse of such persons from $8,000.00 a year to $15,000.00 a year.

109.title: Creating a special registration plate for the American Veteran's Organization (AMVETS)
109.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special registration plate for the American Veteran's Organization (AMVETS).

110.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
110.title: Expanding the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program to children of certain state employees
110.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000.00 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

111.title: Creating an apprenticeship program for barbers and cosmetologists
111.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a barber and cosmetologist apprenticeship program.

112.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
112.title: Providing overtime pay for all employees who are required to work holidays regardless if the holiday hours are in excess of a forty hour workweek
112.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide overtime pay for all employees who are required to work holidays regardless if the holiday hours are in excess of a 40-hour workweek.

113.title: Providing a penalty for employers failing to withhold an employee's income for child support obligations
113.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a $100 a day penalty for employers failing to withhold an employee's income for child support obligations.

114.title: Relating to conditions of bond for defendants in cases of crimes between family or household members
114.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide certain specific statutory conditions of bond in cases involving crimes between family or household members in lieu of allowing the issuing authority to set conditions of bail.

115.title: Increasing the multiplier for a retirement annuity in the public employees retirement system, and deleting language which allows increases in annuity payments for retired Legislators relative to salary increases
115.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the multiplier for a retirement annuity in the Public Employees Retirement System from 2 to 2.5.

116.title: Reallocating the proceeds from limited video lottery by increasing the percentages payable to counties, municipalities and retailers
116.description: The purpose of this bill is to reallocate the proceeds from limited video lottery by increasing the percentages payable to counties, municipalities and retailers.

117.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to promulgate rule implementing a tornado safety awareness plan in public schools
117.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to implement a tornado safety awareness plan in public schools.

118.title: Changing the compulsory school attendance for children in the state from sixteen to eighteen years of age
118.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the compulsory school attendance age for children in the state from sixteen to eighteen years of age.

119.title: Prohibiting charitable organizations from soliciting contributions on public highways
119.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit charitable organizations from soliciting contributions on public highways and providing a penalty for violation.

120.title: Making armed assault or conspiracy to commit armed assault upon school property or school personnel or students a felony
120.description: The purpose of this bill is to make armed assault or conspiracy to commit armed assault upon school property, or against school personnel or students who are on school property, a felony punishable by twenty-five years imprisonment and a $10,000 fine.

121.title: Allowing municipalities to regulate the hours of operation of private liquor clubs by ordinance
121.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow  municipalities to regulate the hours of operation of private liquor clubs by ordinance.  However, the regulation may not allow hours of operation which are in conflict with hours of prohibited  operation set by rule by the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commissioner.

122.title: Assigning benefits directly to providers based on the patients assignment of benefit form
122.description: The purpose of this bill is to assign benefits directly to providers based on the patient's assignment of benefit form.

123.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
123.title: Providing a criminal penalty for transmitting bulk electronic mail messages which are unsolicited
123.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a criminal penalty for transmitting bulk electronic mail messages which are unsolicited.

124.title: Providing that personnel carriers used to transport miners must be maintained at the working section
124.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that personnel carriers or trip cars used to transport miners to a working section must be maintained at the working section and must have sufficient capacity to transport all miners out of the working section in the event of an emergency.

125.title: Requiring that the State School Board ensure that no class size for grades seven through twelve be greater than twenty-five students to every one teacher
125.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all classes in grades seven through twelve in public schools to be no larger than 25 students to one teacher.

126.title: Providing for a pilot project intended to divert low-income residents from early institutionalization
126.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a pilot project intended to divert low-income residents from early institutionalization in nursing homes by providing personal home care in their communities.

127.title: Relating to minimum grab bar standards for hotel and motel rooms that are specifically designated or intended for use by handicapped or disabled guests
127.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the maintenance of sufficient grab bars in hotel and motel rooms which have been set aside or designated to serve the needs of disabled patrons, to reduce the prospect of injury caused by falls in tubs and showers.

128.title: Requiring bids under state contract to disclose the location of work to be performed or risk state  termination of the contract
128.description: The purpose of this bill is to require bids under state contract to disclose the location of work to be performed or risk state termination of the contract.

129.title: Prohibiting law-enforcement officers from asking crime victims if they have insurance coverage to cover losses occasioned by criminal activity
129.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit law-enforcement officers from asking crime victims if they have insurance coverage to cover losses occasioned by criminal activity.  The rationale for the proposal is that law enforcement have less incentive to solve crimes and recover lost property when they believe insurance coverage exists to compensate a victim.  The bill excludes criminal investigations in which law-enforcement officers have reasonable suspicion to believe that a crime has been staged or falsely reported.

130.title: Providing West Virginia students with a partial PROMISE scholarship for schooling outside this state for the reason that no in-state institution offers a course for a major or a degree in the student's desired field
130.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide West Virginia students with a partial PROMISE scholarship for schooling outside the state for the reason that no in-state institution offers a course for a major or a degree in the student's desired field.

131.title: Relating to allowing bus operators for county school systems to carry-over years of experience operating buses for purposes of determining seniority
131.description: The purpose of this bill is to  allow bus operators for county school systems to carry-over years of experience operating buses for purposes of determining seniority.

132.title: Increasing the penalties for discarding trash on land and in streams
132.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for discarding trash on land and in streams, make fines and community service mandatory.

133.title: Requiring the use of helmets by skateboarders
133.description: The purpose of this article is to require the use of helmets on skateboards.

134.title: Providing for reexamination of drivers holding valid drivers licenses who are observed by police officers violating traffic laws or who appear to have caused accidents as the result of negligence or inadequate driving skill
134.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure in which a driver may be required to be reexamined for purposes of maintaining his or her driving privileges after a police officer, upon reasonable grounds, determines that a driver, as the result of an accident or by otherwise committing a driving violation, has exhibited negligence or inadequate driving skill.  To this end, the bill requires that every accident report include a check-off square for an officer to mark when the officer believes a driver should be reexamined.  The bill includes provisions respecting a driver's right to due process in the event a police officer opines that the driver needs to be reexamined.

135.title: Providing limited immunity from civil damages for persons who volunteer their services to public health departments
135.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide immunity from civil damages for persons who volunteer their services to a Public Health Department.

136.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
136.title: Prohibiting out-of-state persons or business entities from soliciting business by written advertisement in this state under certain circumstances
136.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit out-of-state persons or business entities from soliciting business by written advertisement in this state by appearing to be a local or in-state person or business, unless the advertisement shows where the person or business entity is located.  This is to prevent out-of-state businesses from advertising locally with eight hundred numbers to solicit customers and then contracting with a local company at a reduced rate to provide a service without paying sales tax.

137.title: Creating an affirmative defense for certain civil and criminal actions arising from the sale of certain alcoholic drinks and nonintoxicating beer by licensed private clubs to persons under the age of twenty-one
137.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a defense to licensees civilly or criminally charged with selling alcoholic liquors, nonintoxicating beer or wine to minors when the licensees have responsibly used scanner technology to verify age.

138.title: Establishing a volunteer litter reporting program
138.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a volunteer litter reporting program.

139.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
139.title: Excluding disability income received from a veteran for service related injuries from any calculation used to determine spousal support
139.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude disability income received by a veteran from the United States Department of Veterans' Affairs for service related injuries from any calculation used to determine spousal support.

140.title: Relating to the issuance of driver's licenses and disposition
140.description: The purpose of this bill is to require valid proof of identity for a driver's license and permits an applicant two attempts at the written test for a single fee.

141.title: Allowing municipal police and fire pension plans to use the actuarial examination by the State in lieu of obtaining its own actuary
141.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that where the state actuary has examined a Municipal Pension and Relief Fund for a particular year that fund may opt to use that actuarial valuation in place of any other actuarial valuation mandated by state law.

142.title: Dedicating a portion of the receipts from the tax on food products to be distributed equally to each district of the Division of Highways
142.description: The purpose of this bill is to dedicate a portion of the receipts from the tax on food products to be distributed equally to each district of the Division of Highways for the maintenance of secondary roads.

143.title: Providing State Treasury Fire Protection Fund revenue to the West Virginia State Fire Chiefs Association and the West Virginia State Fireman's Association
143.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide State Treasury, Fire Protection Fund revenue to the West Virginia State Fire Chiefs' Association and the West Virginia State Fireman's Association, to be used for both associations' administration and training expenses, and to exempt both associations from eligibility and spending requirements.

144.title: Increasing penalties for the illegal killing, taking, or possessing of certain wildlife
144.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase criminal penalties for the illegal killing, taking or possessing of certain wildlife.

145.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
145.title: Requiring abortion facilities to have certain written policies and procedures
145.description: The purpose of this bill is to require abortion facilities to have certain written policies and procedures.

146.title: Reforming the school aid formula by reducing the regular levy deducted from county boards of education
146.description: The purpose of this bill is to reform the school aid formula by reducing the regular levy deducted from county boards of education for general current expense purposes by 50% of the growth in local share from five years prior.

147.title: Providing a corporate tax credit for qualified health insurance policies provided by corporate employers to employees
147.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a corporate net income tax credit of $2,000.00 per employee, per year, against the net corporate income tax for qualified health insurance policies provided by corporate employers to employees.  The maximum yearly tax credit for eligible corporations would total $30,000.00

148.title: Requiring the DMV to notify the state police when a registered sex offender purchases, trades or registers a motor vehicle
148.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Division of Motor Vehicles to notify the West Virginia State Police when a registered sex offender purchases, trades or registers a motor vehicle.

220.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Physical Therapy to promulgate a legislative rule relating to General Provisions.

221.title: Authorizing the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety to promulgate legislative rules
221.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Criteria and Procedures for Determination of Projected Cost per Day for Inmates Incarcerated in Regional Jails Operated by the Authority.

222.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2819
222.title: Registered Professional Nurses, Policies Standards and Criteria for the Evaluation and Accreditation of Colleges or Schools of Nursing
222.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Policies, Standards and Criteria for the Evaluation and Accreditation of Colleges, Departments or Schools of Nursing.

223.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2819
223.title: Registered Professional Nurses, Limited Prescriptive Authority
223.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Limited Prescriptive Authority for Nurses in Advanced Practice.

224.title: Authorizing the Department of Education and the Arts to Promulgate Legislative Rules
224.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Rehabilitation Services to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Low Vision Driver Training Program.

225.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2819
225.title: Respiratory Care, Student Temporary Permits
225.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Respiratory Care to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Student Temporary Permits.

226.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2819
226.title: Secretary of State, Administration of the Address Confidentiality Program
226.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Secretary of State to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Administration of the Address Confidentiality Program.

227.title: Tax Department, Combined Returns Pursuant to an Investigation by the Tax Commissioner
227.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Combined Returns Pursuant to an Investigation by the Tax Commissioner.

228.title: Tax Department, Film Industry Investment Tax Credit
228.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to combined returns pursuant to the Film Industry Investment Tax Credit.

229.title: Tax Department, Electronic Filing of Payment of Special District Excise Tax
229.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Electronic Filing and Payment of Special District Excise Tax.

230.title: Tax Department, Withholding or Denial of Personal Income Tax Refunds
230.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Withholding or Denial of Personal Income Tax Refunds from Taxpayers Who Owe Municipal Costs, Fines, Forfeitures or Penalties.

231.title: Tax Department, Exchange of Information Agreement
231.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to an exchange of information agreement between the State Tax Division and the Department of Health and Human Resources Office of the Inspector General Medicaid Fraud Control Unit.

232.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2819
232.title: Veterinary Medicine, Schedule of Fees
232.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia, 1931, as amended, relating to authorizing the Board of Veterinary Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to a Schedule of Fees.

233.title: Relating to increasing the maximum cash award the Employee Suggestion Award Board may make for an individual award
233.description: The purpose of this bill is to: (1) Increase the maximum cash award the Employee Suggestion Award Board may make for an individual award to $16,000; (2) Require the Board to report to the Legislature every five years the amount the maximum award amount would need to be adjusted to compensate for inflation and give its recommendation, if any, addressing the amount the maximum award amount should be changed; and (3) Allow the Governor to make a secondary award of up to $5,000 for suggestions the Board has approved if the suggestion is implemented in one or more additional state agencies.

234.title: Income tax exemption for veterans who locate in West Virginia following separation from service
234.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from state income tax, for five years, veterans and their spouses who locate in the state following separation from military service.

235.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
235.title: Making the use of permanent replacements for striking workers an unfair labor practice in certain instances
235.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the use of permanent replacements for striking workers an unfair labor practice by employers who have employee stock ownership plans.

236.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
236.title: Establishing the crime of partial birth infanticide
236.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the crime of partial birth infanticide.

237.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
237.title: Providing rape victims with reliable emergency information regarding pregnancy and abortion, and providing those victims with emergency contraception if they desire
237.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide rape victims with reliable emergency information regarding pregnancy and abortion, and to provide those victims with emergency contraception if they desire it.

238.title: Exempting nonprofit organizations from paying an annual motor vehicle registration fee
238.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt nonprofit organizations from paying an annual motor vehicle registration fee for vehicles used exclusively to carry out its goals and purposes.

239.title: Prohibiting the use of a person's credit history in insurance transactions
239.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a person's credit history in insurance transactions.

240.title: Relating to credit card solicitation on college campuses
240.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a misdemeanor penalty for violations of law and rules on credit card solicitation on college campuses.

241.title: Creating sales and use tax exemptions for purchases of design and engineering services and materials and equipment directly used in construction of new or replacement amusement rides
241.description: The purpose of this bill is to create sales and use tax exemptions for purchases of design and engineering services and materials and equipment directly used in construction of new or replacement amusement rides or for leases of amusement rides to qualified operators in long established West Virginia amusement parks having historical character.

242.title: Creating the joint commission on technology and advanced communications
242.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Joint Commission on Technology and Advanced Communications and include nonlegislative members.

243.title: Prohibiting solid waste authorities from duplicating or competing with private recycling businesses
243.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit solid waste authorities from duplicating or competing with private recycling businesses.

244.title: Relating to the denial of course credits for unexcused absences in school
244.description: The purpose of this bill is to deny course credit for a designated number of unexcused absences in a semester or year.

245.title: Providing a cost-of-living provision for certain persons retired under the teachers retirement system
245.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a cost-of-living provision for certain persons retired under the Teachers Retirement System.    Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

246.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
246.title: Providing an employee the right to decline to work more than forty hours in a workweek
246.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that an employee has the right to decline to work more than forty hours in a workweek.

247.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
247.title: Requiring employers to pay nurses at their regular rate of pay for all the time they are on-call on the employer's premises
247.description: The purpose of this bill is to require  employers to pay nurses at their regular rate of pay for all the time they are on-call on the employer's premises.

248.title: Allowing comparable credit at trade or vocational schools approved by the State Board to count towards service personnel pay rates
248.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to make section consistent with previous amendments that allows comparable credit at trade or vocational schools approved by the state board to count towards certain service personnel pay rates.

249.title: Salary increases for public employees based upon residential housing costs
249.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide salary increases for state employees based upon residential housing costs.  The employee shall receive an annual salary increase of two percent of the employee's regular salary for every ten percent that residential home prices in that employee's county exceed the statewide average for residential homes.

250.title: Providing meetings and conference rights for members of municipal fire departments
250.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide meetings and conference rights for members of municipal fire departments. The bill also creates duties for the firefighters' Civil Service Commissions.

251.title: Providing a tax credit to landlords who rent to parolees
251.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a tax credit to landlords who rent residential property to parolees.

252.title: Making the offense of failure to wear safety belts a primary offense
252.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the offense of failure to wear safety belts to a primary offense.

253.title: Requiring notice of an abortion to be provided to the father of the unborn child
253.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that a woman contemplating an abortion provide the name of the father to the physician, clinic or medical facility performing the abortion and to require the physician, clinic or medical facility to notify the father of the proposed abortion.

254.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
254.title: Relating to the "Mandated Benefits Review Act"
254.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Insurance Commissioner to review and report to the Legislature in an actuarially-based fashion the financial and other related impacts of any proposed legislation to mandate medical or health-related benefits.

255.title: Exempting undergraduate students attending state colleges or universities for the first two years postgraduation, from the payment of state income tax
255.description: The purpose of this bill is to give current undergraduate students relief from paying state income taxes and graduates of undergraduate programs relief from state income taxes for a period of two years. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

256.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
256.title: Prohibiting family planning centers that receive state funding from discussing abortion
256.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit family planning centers in West Virginia that receive state funding from discussing abortion or abortion referrals.

257.title: Providing full daily rate of pay for substitute teachers if they have in excess of ten instructional days in the same school year
257.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide full daily rate of pay for substitute teachers if they have in excess of ten instructional days in the same school year.

258.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
258.title: Relating to the creation and implementation of drug-free workplaces in coal mines
258.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the number of mine employees who may be tested for drug or alcohol abuse by requiring all mine operators to create drug-free workplace programs applicable to safety-sensitive employees on mine property.  Safety sensitive employees are defined to include engineering and certain operational staff.  It would also require vendors providing such employees to implement the same program.  The bill also allows employers who discharge employees who test positive to be immune from wrongful discharge lawsuits.  The bill requires the suspension of mining certifications for positive confirmed drug tests and provides a mechanism for the reinstatement of certificates upon meeting minimum requirements of being drug free.  In addition, the bill proposes minimum drug and alcohol awareness educational requirements for miners and emergency services personnel in mines. The bill also provides that employees who test positive lose the right to receive indemnity benefits and common law right to sue.  Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

259.title: Authorizing governing bodies of municipalities and county commissions to transfer early in-person voting ballots to precincts in the manner absentee ballots are delivered
259.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize governing bodies of municipalities and county commissions to transfer early in-person voting ballots to precincts in the manner absentee ballots are delivered, which is one day before the election.

260.title: Exempting Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions form state income tax
260.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions from state income tax law.

261.title: Making it a misdemeanor to file a frivolous lawsuit
261.description: The purpose of this bill is to discourage the filing of any frivolous claims and keep the court system from being clogged with cases of no merit.

262.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
262.title: Requiring medical practitioners who perform abortions to estimate the gestational age of the fetus by using ultrasound
262.description: The purpose of this bill is to require medical practitioners who perform abortions to estimate the gestational age of the fetus by using ultrasound analysis and measurement.  The bill also prescribes a criminal fine for violations of the section.

263.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
263.title: Requiring the Office of Miners Health and Safety to employ qualified diesel inspectors
263.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Office of Miners Health and Safety to employ qualified diesel inspectors.

264.title: Requiring public utilities to file with the county commission in each county in which it provides service, copies of all proposed tariffs and schedules showing all the rates, charges and tolls
264.description: The purpose of this bill is to require public utilities to file with the clerk of the county commission in each county in which it provides service, or proposes to provide service, copies of all proposed tariffs and all schedules showing all the rates, charges and tolls for service to be rendered by it or by other persons, firms or corporations in connection with it.

265.title: Creating a registry of convictions for operating a clandestine drug laboratory
265.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a registry of persons convicted of operating a clandestine drug laboratory.  The proposal includes provisions designating certain information to be contained on the registry and directing the Criminal Identification Bureau of the State Police to create a website using descriptive terms for the public to access relative to the information in the registry.

266.title: Providing that a county commission may establish a program for transfer of development rights without the requirement for an election
266.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a county commission may establish a program for transfer of development rights without the requirement for an election on an ordinance for the program.

267.title: Modifying the check cashing service fee
267.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the check cashing service fee making it consistent with the national average which is three percent government, five percent payroll and ten percent for personal checks of the face value of the check cashed.

268.title: Relating to approval of a student for homebound services and their rights
268.description: The purpose of the bill is to enable homebound students to continue their education without having to be approved every nine weeks and to enable homebound students to progress in school at the same rate as regular students.

269.title: Increasing certain penalties for persons convicted of domestic battery and domestic assault
269.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase certain penalties for persons convicted of domestic battery and domestic assault including the requirement that they complete an approved batterers' course.

270.title: Relating to itinerant status for school service personnel
270.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish itinerant status for school service personnel and provide for inclusion of certain information on a notice of job vacancy.

271.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
271.title: Establishing the Flexible Leave Act
271.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Flexible Leave Act allowing for the use of earned leave with pay for an illness in an employee's immediate family.

272.title: Relating to suspension of drivers license for certain offenses if committed by college students
272.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit issuance of a temporary license allowing driving to and from college and classes when there was a suspension of drivers license not involving DUI or other serious driving offense committed by college students.

273.title: Relating to the distribution of the State Treasurer's "Road Fund"
273.description: The purpose of this bill is to distribute the State Treasurer's "Road Fund" proportionally in each county according to the tax revenue generated from that county.

274.title: Regulating telemarketing for quasi-state agencies
274.description: The purpose of this bill is to  regulate telemarketing by quasi-state agencies.

275.title: Income tax deduction for gifts to West Virginia charities
275.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit deductions from federal adjusted gross income, for personal income tax purposes, for contributions to religious, educational or charitable organizations.

276.title: Providing for the use of neck braces by football players
276.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission to adopt rules to provide for use of neck braces by football players in interscholastic athletic football events.

277.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
277.title: Requiring that abortions be performed in hospitals or by physicians with admitting privileges to a hospital within the local service area
277.description: The purpose of this bill   is to  require that abortions be performed in hospitals or by physicians with admitting privileges to a hospital within the local service area.

278.title: Providing that identity theft is a felony if a person commits the crime with the intent to commit any other crime
278.description: The purpose of this bill is to  amend the crime of identity theft to provide that it is a felony if a person commits the crime with the intent to commit any other crime.  Current statutory language limits the felony to persons who commit the crime with the intent to fraudulently represent themselves as another person for purposes of making credit or financial transactions.

279.title: Increasing the required bond for certain businesses regulated by the Division of Motor Vehicles to fifty thousand dollars
279.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of the required bond of certain businesses regulated by the Division of Motor Vehicles to $50,000.

280.title: Relating to a tax exemption on certain sales of clothing
