280.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the consumer's sales tax on sales of clothing.  The Tax Commissioner is authorized to propose rules to further the intent of the article.

281.title: Prohibiting the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings
281.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings.

282.title: Authorizing county tax assessors to choose not to impose the property tax in a county on businesses for property that is business inventory intended for resale
282.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county tax assessors to  choose not to impose the property tax in a county on businesses for property that is business inventory intended for resale.

283.title: Prohibiting individual county board of education members from acting on behalf of the board in an individual capacity unless authorized by law
283.description: The purpose of this bill is to recusal of board members during certain votes and prohibit individual county board of education members from acting on behalf of the board in an individual capacity unless authorized by law.  The bill also assesses personal liability for violations.

284.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
284.title: Requiring that permanent and temporary battery charging stations in mines be ventilated directly to the return on a separate split of air
284.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that permanent and temporary battery charging stations in mines be ventilated directly to the return on a separate split of air.

285.title: Allowing for an adjusted gross income of a taxpayer for contributions to the maintenance and improvement of state, county and municipal parks
285.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for a reduction in the adjusted gross income of a taxpayer for contributions to the maintenance and improvement of state, county and municipal parks.

286.title: Crediting a deceased teacher's sick leave toward continued insurance coverage for a surviving spouse and other dependents
286.description: The purpose of this bill is to credit a deceased teacher's sick leave toward continued insurance coverage for a surviving spouse and other dependents.  The bill provides that if a surviving spouse or other dependents are not covered by the deceased spouse's public employee insurance, that they receive the monetary value of the accumulated sick leave.

287.title: Changing compulsory school attendance until age eighteen or until the student graduates
287.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the compulsory school attendance until age eighteen or until the student graduates.

288.title: Changing the amount a person can earn while receiving unemployment benefits
288.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the amount a person can earn while receiving unemployment compensation benefits, without it changing the benefits received, from $60 a week to forty percent of the person's weekly benefit rate.

289.title: Relating to a no telephone solicitation contact (Do Not Call) list
289.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that telephone subscribers and telephone service consumers, desiring to be placed on a "Do Not Call" list, indicating that the subscriber or consumer does not wish to receive telephone solicitations, may pay a modest fee to be placed on the "Do Not Call" list maintained by the Public Service Commission.  The bill also provides penalties for violations of the "Do No Call" list.

290.title: Imposing an excise tax on the sale or rental of obscene materials
290.description: The purpose of this bill is to produce revenue by imposition of a tax upon the sale or rental of obscene materials.

291.title: Relating to requiring lien holders to notify the sheriff's office via written instrument and to record a release in the county clerk's office within sixty days after the lien has been satisfied
291.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lien holders to notify the sheriff's office via written instrument and to record a release in the county clerk's office within sixty days after the lien has been satisfied; require that the lien be removed from record upon satisfaction; and provide penalties for failure to notify the sheriff and county clerk of satisfaction.

292.title: Creating the criminal offense of harassment of a participant of a neighborhood crime watch
292.description: The purpose of this section is to create the criminal offense of harassment of a participant of a neighborhood crime watch.  Toward this purpose, the bill defines applicable terms and provides a criminal penalty.

293.title: Eliminating fees charged by the Criminal Identification Bureau to the State Police for providing certain information to volunteer fire departments
293.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate fees charged by the Criminal Identification Bureau of the West Virginia State Police for providing certain information to volunteer fire departments.

294.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
294.title: Requiring a certified person to examine underground mines after cutting and welding has been performed
294.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a properly certified person to examine underground mines after cutting and welding has been performed to determine if there are any hot spots not previously undiscovered. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

295.title: Empowering certain county and municipalities to deny a development activity if adequate public facilities, assets and services are not available to support the activity
295.description: The purpose of this bill is to empower counties, municipalities or their planning commissions in areas where impact fees are charged to deny authorization for a development activity if any of them determine that adequate public facilities, assets and services are not available to support the activity and expanding the list of facilities and services which must be available to include libraries and library services.

296.title: Establishing a secure residential school for juvenile status offenders
296.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a secure residential school for juvenile status offenders; and to provide an alternative school for children who are expelled or suspended from regular school by permitting them to attend evening classes or night school.

297.title: Allowing mental hygiene commissioners to carry concealed weapons
297.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow Mental Hygiene Commissioners to carry concealed weapons.

298.title: Limiting the purchase of handguns to one gun per month
298.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the purchase of handguns to one gun per month.  The bill exempts law-enforcement, correctional facilities, and private security companies from the limitation while providing criminal penalties.  Finally, it exempts antique firearms from the limitation.

299.title: Excluding certain employment-related expenses from the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support
299.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude certain employment-related expenses from the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support.

300.title: Prohibiting the demolition of a historic structure prior to a review of and the issuance of a permit by the Commissioner of the Division of Culture and History
300.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the demolition of a historic structure prior to a review of and the issuance of a permit for the undertaking by the Commissioner of the Division of Culture and History.

301.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
301.title: Prohibiting the performance of any abortion when the woman seeking it is doing so solely on account of the gender of the fetus
301.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the performance of any abortion when the woman seeking it is doing so solely on account of the gender of the fetus.  The bill also prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of the section.

302.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
302.title: Allowing pharmacists and other individuals involved in dispensing medicines to refuse to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance that can be used as part of an abortion-related procedure
302.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow pharmacists and other individuals involved in dispensing medicines to refuse to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance that can be used as an abortifacient or that can be used as part of an abortion-related procedure.

303.title: Exempting from personal property taxation, the equipment, inventory and raw materials of crafts people who have had their work evaluated and accepted or juried and accepted by the West Virginia arts and crafts guild
303.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from personal property taxation, the equipment, inventory and raw materials of crafts people who have had their work evaluated and accepted or juried and accepted by the West Virginia Arts and Crafts Guild or by a similar organization.

304.title: Revising appointment and compensation provisions of the Supreme Court Clerk and his or her staff
304.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise appointment and compensation provisions of the supreme court clerk and his or her staff.

305.title: Relating to impersonation of a public official or employee
305.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the term "impersonation" of a public official or employee includes the act of operating a motor vehicle which falsely displays an official emblem or other marking  connoting government sponsorship.

306.title: Relating to acquisition of a municipal business license
306.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the code by removing an outdated reference to state licensure tax on businesses and its required use by municipalities.  This bill will permit the governing body of a municipality to enact an ordinance to continue the municipal licensure of businesses.

307.title: Relating to the West Virginia Partnership to Promote Community Well-Being
307.description: The purpose of this bill is to codify the West Virginia Partnership to Promote Community Well-Being established by Executive Order No. 8-04.

308.title: Updating the law governing the practice of occupational therapy
308.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the law governing practice of occupational therapy.

309.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Education and the Arts - Division of Culture and History

310.title: Allowing certain county boards of education to operate their schools on a four-day school week
310.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county boards of education in low density counties to operate their schools on a four-day school week basis.

311.title: Authorizing the National Coal Heritage Area Authority to assist in the historical, cultural, recreational and economic development of Coalwood Way
311.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the National Coal Heritage Area Authority to assist in the historical, cultural, recreational and economic development of Coalwood Way and related sites in the Big Creek District of McDowell County.

312.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
312.title: Requiring that every woman seeking an abortion be given the opportunity to see an ultrasound image of the fetus
312.description: The purpose of this bill is to require every woman seeking an abortion to be given the opportunity to see an ultrasound image of the fetus.  The bill also prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of the section.  It also provides that nothing in the section can be construed as approving of abortion.

313.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
313.title: Relating to a severance tax imposed on surface mining activities
313.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose a severance tax on surface mining activities with proceeds dedicated to the Surface Mine Reclamation Fund.

314.title: Relating to eligibility for parole
314.description: The purpose of this bill is to create disincentives for violent behavior in correctional facilities by requiring six months' good behavior before being released on parole, and by suspending an inmate's parole hearing for six months' for violent behavior.

315.title: Relating to unlawful possession of deadly weapons by a minor
315.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the presiding officer of a  juvenile proceeding to order a juvenile taken into custody or a law-enforcement official to take a juvenile into custody when there is probable cause to believe  that juvenile has illegally possessed a deadly weapon, and to permit waiver and transfer of jurisdiction from juvenile proceeding to criminal jurisdiction if there is probable cause to believe  that juvenile has illegally possessed a deadly weapon.

316.title: Requiring racetracks who are licensed to operate video lottery terminals pay a fee of one thousand dollars for each machine and that the revenue from these fees are to be transferred to the benefit fund of the Teachers Retirement System
316.description: The purpose of this bill is to add a new section to require racetracks who are licensed to operate video lottery terminals to pay a fee of $1,000 for each machine which it is licensed to operate and it provides that the revenue from these additional fees are to be transferred to the benefit fund of the State Teachers Retirement System.

317.title: Exempting motorcycles from the requirement of annual registration
317.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the registration of motorcycles for twenty-four months.

318.title: Creating a Sentencing Commission
318.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a Sentencing Commission and setting forth its membership, responsibilities, powers and duties.  The bill also requires that the commission evaluate the state's sentencing and correctional laws and policies and make recommendations to the Governor and the Legislature.

319.title: Providing for a modification to federal adjusted gross income for expenses incurred by organ donors
319.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a modification to federal adjusted gross income for expenses incurred by organ donors.

320.title: Extending the alternative-fuel motor vehicle tax credit for ten years and making the credit retroactive from the expiration date of the initial credit
320.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the alternative-fuel motor vehicles tax credit for ten years and to make the credit retroactive from the expiration date of the initial credit.

321.title: Authorizing a corporation net income tax credit for reducing charges for home heating fuel and propane gas provided to low-income residents
321.description: The purpose of this bill is to  authorize a corporation net income tax credit for reducing charges for home heating fuel and propane gas provided to low-income residents.

322.title: Granting public employees credit toward their West Virginia public employee retirement benefits for service in the Peace Corps
322.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant Peace Corps members credited service toward the West Virginia public employees retirement benefits, even if they are not public employees at the time of their service.

323.title: Giving abutting landowners of public lands a right of first refusal to lease or buy public lands
323.description: The purpose of this bill is to  give abutting landowners of state property a right of first refusal to lease or buy public lands .

324.title: Extending the deadline for submission of the written plan for participation in the pilot program for increased powers for municipal self government
324.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the deadline for submission of the written plan for participation in the pilot program for increased powers for municipal self government.

325.title: Allowing county school boards to establish a four-day school week and collect fees for use of school buildings on the fifth day
325.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county school boards to establish a four-day school week and collect fees for use of school buildings on the fifth day from community organizations that provide student support programs.

326.title: Providing cost-of-living benefits to retired teachers funded from the severance tax collections on natural gas
326.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide cost-of-living benefits to retired teachers to be funded from the severance tax collected on natural gas.

327.title: Increasing the Public Service Commission appointees and requiring that there be one appointee from each congressional district and two at-large appointments
327.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the Public Service Commission appointees from three to five; and requiring that there be one appointee from each congressional district and two at-large appointments.

328.title: Requiring all high schools include in their health classes a course in fetal development
328.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all high schools include in their health classes a course in fetal development.

329.title: Requiring that all decisions regarding certain reductions in full-time classified personnel workforce at state institutions of higher education be made on the basis of seniority
329.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that all decisions regarding temporary or permanent reductions in full-time classified personnel workforce at state institutions of higher education, in situations where a job is reduced by reducing the number of days or hours worked, be made on the basis of seniority.

330.title: Allowing teachers who graduated from colleges and universities that are not accredited by associations recognized in West Virginia, to obtain a teaching certificate based on their certification in another state
330.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow teachers who graduated from colleges and universities that are not accredited by associations recognized in West Virginia, to obtain a teaching certificate based on their certification in another state of at least ten years.

331.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
331.title: Providing state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel
331.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel.

332.title: Including ambulance and fire fees as part of the property tax assessment so that the fees and property taxes may be paid with the same check
332.description: The purpose of this bill is to include ambulance and fire fees as part of the property tax assessment so that the fees and property taxes may be paid with the same check.

333.title: Providing restrictions for an elected or appointed public official relating to reemployment after retirement
333.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the ability of an elected or appointed public official to retire from his or her position, commence to receive an annuity, and continue to receive the annuity if he or she is reelected or reappointed to the same position within twelve months of retirement.

334.title: Relating to the federal "Yellow Ribbon G. I. Education Enhancement Program"
334.description: The purpose of this bill is to require West Virginia public colleges and universities to participate in the federal Yellow Ribbon G.I. Education Enhancement Program ("the Program"). The Program will be established pursuant to the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008 ("the Act") to provide eligible post-9/11 veterans additional moneys towards the cost of tuition and fees at institutions of higher education.  The Act will provide educational benefits to certain post-9/11 veterans in an amount equal to the cost of in-state tuition at the most expensive public university or college in the state.  The Program will authorize the federal Secretary of Veterans Affairs to cover fifty percent of any additional costs over and above the cost of in-state tuition in exchange for a matching contribution of equal percentage from an institution of higher learning.

335.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
335.title: Relating generally to unemployment compensation and the unemployment compensation trust fund
335.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for temporary solvency assessments on employees and employers when the balance of the unemployment compensation trust fund is less than $180 million at the end of a calendar quarter, to provide for the cessation of solvency assessments when the balance of the unemployment compensation trust fund exceeds $250 million on the last day of any calendar quarter and to ensure that maximum weekly benefit rates do not increase or decrease during the pendency of temporary solvency assessments.

336.title: Authorizing the Governor to pay a nonbase building salary enhancement to eligible state employees
336.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Governor to pay a nonbase building salary enhancement to eligible state employees provided that the Legislature appropriates moneys for that specific purpose.

337.title: Eliminating the six month waiting period for those in the Teachers Retirement System to receive disability retirement benefits
337.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the six month waiting period for those in the Teachers Retirement System to receive disability retirement benefits.

338.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
338.title: Allowing a hospital physician to decline performing an abortion when a mother's life is not in imminent danger
338.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a hospital physician to decline performing an abortion when a mother's life is not in imminent danger.

339.title: Approving fee waivers for certain students and faculty and staff at institutions of higher education and providing that nonresident faculty and staff may get the exemption only up to the amount of in-state tuition
339.description: The purpose of this bill is to approve fee waivers for certain students and faculty and staff at institutions of higher education at undergraduate and graduate levels.  The bill  applies this exemption to all such institutions.  It further provides that nonresident faculty and staff may get the exemption only up to the amount of in-state tuition.

340.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to create a school drug safety program
340.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to create a school drug safety program.  The bill would require the program to include drug testing of individuals prior to  being hired, transferred or promoted to positions within a school and include random drug testing of all individuals employed in a school.

341.title: Allowing for juveniles to be tried as adults for instances of child abuse resulting in bodily injury and child abuse which results in death
341.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for juveniles to be tried as adults for instances of child abuse resulting in bodily injury and child abuse which results in death.

342.title: Captive Cervid Farming Act
342.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate captive cervid farming as an agricultural enterprise in this state.  Toward this purpose, the bill describes powers and duties of the Department of Agriculture; provides for rule-making authority; sets forth duties and obligations of the commissioner; provides for an application process; provides for the issuance, renewal, modification, and transfer of a license certificate; provides for inspection of facilities; provides for the transition of current facilities; addresses noncompliance with article and provides for certain criminal penalties and remedies due to noncompliance.

343.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
343.title: Relating to medicaid monitoring and case management
343.description: The purpose of this bill is to require payment to both individuals and married couples who are Medicaid recipients, who are residents in nursing homes or personal care homes, $45 or $65 a month respectively for their personal needs accounts, in addition to sums received from Medicaid.  This shall be an increase of the current limits on said personal use accounts from $30 or $50 respectively.

344.title: Exempting from state and personal income tax the benefits a retired teacher receives from the State Teachers Retirement System under certain circumstances
344.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from state personal income tax the benefits a retired teacher receives from the State Teachers Retirement System, provided that teacher on or before March 6, 1972, elected to participate to the full extent permitted by his or her salary in that retirement system.

345.title: Providing that the PEIA Finance Board may make optional plans available as an IRS plan or as part of the preferred provider benefits
345.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the PEIA Finance Board may make optional plans available as an IRS plan or as part of the preferred provider benefits.

346.title: Requiring the preservation of biological evidence found in connection with a criminal case, and establishing penalties for violations
346.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the preservation of biological evidence found in connection with a criminal case so that the evidence is available for DNA testing. It also establishes criminal penalties for violations.

347.title: Requiring mandatory community service upon conviction of a misdemeanor offense of driving under the influence and creating a central registry
347.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mandatory community service upon conviction of a misdemeanor offense of driving under the influence and creation of a central registry of persons convicted of driving under the influence.

348.title: Providing for continuing contract status for teachers and establishing dismissal and suspension procedures
348.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for continuing contract status for teachers and establish dismissal and suspension procedures.

349.title: Providing that the transfer of development rights are renewable
349.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that transfer of development rights are renewable; making the rights transferred be for twenty years and a reversion of twenty years; and authorizing the county commission to stagger the time rights transferred.

350.title: Prohibiting the placement of automated teller machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals
350.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the placement of automated teller machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals and to only allow fraternal and veterans organizations to renew their licenses for limited video lottery.

351.title: Providing nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education
351.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education through continuing contracts and dismissal for cause.

352.title: Relating to the crime victims compensation program
352.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow awards, under the crime victims compensation program, to be made to victims of identity theft.

353.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
353.title: Creating the Traumatic Brain Injury Services Commission
353.description: The purpose of this article is to create a new commission for the service to veterans and others suffering from traumatic brain injuries.

354.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
354.title: Removing certain exceptions in the definitions of employer and employee covered by the West Virginia minimum wage law
354.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove certain exceptions in the definitions of employer and employee covered by the West Virginia minimum wage law.

355.title: Exempting acts resulting in the taking or damaging of private property for public use from the immunity granted to a political subdivision
355.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt takings, including regulatory takings, from the immunity granted to a political subdivision.

356.title: Providing for a Public Service Commission investigation for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission
356.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a Public Service Commission investigator for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission and in which an individual suffers severe bodily injury or death.

357.title: Including a tax checkoff option for Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp
357.description: The purpose of this bill is to include on the state personal income tax return a checkoff option to donate some or all of any tax refund to the "Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp  Checkoff Program"   for the operation of the camp.     Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

358.title: Defining "spelunking" as a recreational purpose and activity for which a landowner's liability for injury is limited
358.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "caving" as a recreational purpose and activity for which a landowner's liability for injury is limited.

359.title: Insuring that tobacco products are not sold in any packaging other than the original
359.description: The purpose of this bill is to insure that tobacco products are not sold in any packaging other than the original factory wrapped package and to insure that cigarettes are not sold individually.

360.title: Requiring lobbyists and lawyers providing lobbying services to pay service tax
360.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lobbyists and lawyers when performing lobbying services to pay collect consumer sales and service tax.

361.title: Creating multi-year hunting, fishing and trapping licenses
361.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to create multi-year hunting, fishing and trapping licenses in increments of three, five or ten years.  The director is authorized to set fees for the multi-year licenses by legislative rule.

362.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
362.title: Jobs Impact Statement Act
362.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a jobs impact statement to be completed by the West Virginia Development Office for certain proposed legislation which may cause an impact on the West Virginia economy.

363.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
363.title: Providing standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs
363.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs and require hospitals to provide free charity care to uninsured citizens below poverty level and lowered rates to those citizens between one hundred and three hundred percent above poverty level.

364.title: Requiring the Public Service Commission to allow Class I cities to enter into one or more agreements with contract carriers by motor vehicle
364.description: The purpose of this bill is  to requiring the Public Service Commission to allow Class I cities to enter into one or more agreements with contract carriers by motor vehicle .

365.title: Relating to fleeing form a law-enforcement officer
365.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a felony offense for certain persons convicted of fleeing a law-enforcement officer.

366.title: Raising the state salary level to at least one hundred twenty-five percent above the Federal Poverty Guidelines
366.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the state salary level to at least one hundred twenty-five percent above the Federal Poverty Guidelines.

367.title: Making the senior citizens discount on campground rental fees at state parks available year-round
367.description: The purpose of this bill is to  make the fifty percent discount on campground rental fees at state parks for West Virginia senior citizens available year-round, instead of during the "off-season" only.

368.title: Increasing the amount of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management
368.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the limit of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management from $75,000 to $125,000.

369.title: Providing for increased compensation for aides and paraprofessionals with large numbers of pupils in kindergarten and grades one through six
369.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for increased compensation for aides and paraprofessionals with large numbers of pupils in kindergarten and grades one through six.

370.title: Releasing the name and identification of any juvenile adjudicated or convicted of a crime to the victims
370.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the release of the identity of juveniles adjudicated or convicted of a crime to the victim of the juvenile offense.

371.title: Authorizing county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income
371.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income.

372.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
372.title: Requiring faith-based, abstinence-only and antichoice facilities to have written policies and procedures
372.description: The purpose of this bill is to require faith-based, abstinence-only and antichoice facilities to have certain written policies and procedures.

373.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
373.title: Requiring any faith-based facility that counsels women regarding contraception, abortion or pregnancy to maintain a quality assurance program
373.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require any faith-based facility that counsels women regarding contraception, abortion or pregnancy to maintain a quality assurance program.

374.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
374.title: Removing the exemption from planning and zoning restrictions for mining and manufacturing activities and uses
374.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the zoning exemption regarding existing uses for mining and manufacturing activities.

375.title: Allowing a school service mechanic to have experience, training and certifications considered towards his or her pay rate
375.description: The purpose of this bill is to  allow a school service mechanic to have experience, training and certifications considered towards his or her pay rate.

376.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
376.title: Providing for the adequate staffing of nursing homes and training of nursing home staff
376.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the adequate staffing of nursing homes and training of nursing home staff.

377.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
377.title: Relating to the removal of the exemption for government employees performing electrical work on government property from having to possess an electrician's license

378.title: Salary increases for school service employees based upon residential housing costs
378.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide salary increases for school service personnel  based upon residential housing costs. The employee shall receive an annual salary increase of two percent of the employee's regular salary for every ten percent that residential home prices in that employee's county exceed the statewide average for residential homes.

379.title: Providing that attendance of college by a noncustodial parent may not be used as grounds to modify a child support order
379.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the attendance of college by a noncustodial parent may not be used as grounds to modify a child support order.

380.title: Relating to the employment and compensation of school service personnel
380.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify when aides should be considered supervisory employees for purposes of receiving pay at a higher pay grade and to provide that classroom aides in kindergarten classrooms which have more pupils than the maximum pupil/teacher ratio receive additional compensation as to professional personnel in said classrooms The bill also creates two new positions for bus drivers and establishes a pay grade for those positions.

381.title: Salary increase for sanitarian employees of the division of health
381.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a 25% across-the-board salary increase for sanitarian employees of the Division of Health to bring their salaries into parity with county sanitarian employee salaries, and to additionally provide for an annual cost-of-living salary increase.

382.title: Prohibiting any person convicted of any felony from voting in an election of state and local officials
382.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit any person convicted of any felony from voting in a state election.

383.title: Allowing the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a "School Choice Zone"
383.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a School Choice Zone which would enable students residing in the designated area to attend school in a neighboring county if they wish.

384.title: Relating to the Public Employees Retirement System and the Teachers Retirement System; and providing a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years
384.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years.

385.title: Relating to the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support
385.description: The purpose of this bill is to define gross income for purposes of determining child support and to provide that certain employment-related expenses are excluded from gross income.

386.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
386.title: Establishing in the state treasury a targeted minority economic development fund to address economic issues of minorities and minority communities
386.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish in the State Treasury a targeted minority economic development fund to address economic issues of minorities and minority communities.

387.title: Expanding the membership of the Racing Commission and reorganizing the administrative functions
387.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the membership of the Racing Commission from three to five members and reorganizes the administrative functions of the West Virginia Racing Commission by establishing a State Racing Office and creating the position of Director of Racing.  The Director of Racing will be a gubernatorial appointee and will be responsible for the daily management of the authorities and responsibilities of the West Virginia Racing Commission.

388.title: Requiring that motor vehicle insurance certificate may be issued only for the time period for which the insured pays for coverage
388.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that motor vehicle insurance certificates may be issued only for the time period for which the insured pays for coverage.

389.title: Allowing the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)
389.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers' Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)and to specify the cost of the service credit purchased.

390.title: Providing a loan forgiveness program for nurses
390.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a loan forgiveness program for nurses similar to what currently exists for medical doctors and osteopathic physicians.

391.title: Setting standards for assignment of high school athletic directors
391.description: The purpose of this bill is to set standards for school athletic directors.  The bill also requires a high school to assign a full-time athletic director if the school has thirteen or more varsity sports, and at least a half-time athletic director if the school has twelve or less varsity sports.

392.title: Providing for mandatory sentences for any person who shoots a police officer on duty
392.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mandatory sentence of fifteen years for any person who maliciously shoots a police officer on duty, while providing a mandatory sentence of ten years for any person who unlawfully, but not maliciously, shoots a police officer on duty.

393.title: Authorizing the issuance of special license plates for pharmacists
393.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of special license plates for pharmacists.

394.title: Subtracting social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income
394.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax.

395.title: Sexually Violent Predator Act
395.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure for committing violent sex offenders after they have served prison terms or when they have been found unfit to stand trial.

396.title: Providing a salary supplement for providers of medicaid eligible services in the public schools
396.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a salary supplement for providers of Medicaid eligible services in the public schools and, additionally, providing the financing therefor.

397.title: Providing that certain mental hygiene commissioners are eligible for membership in the Public Employees Retirement System
397.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain mental hygiene commissioners are eligible for membership in the Public Employees Retirement System.

398.title: Providing for tuition and fee waiver for certain child survivors of domestic violence deaths
398.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide tuition and fee waivers at public institutions of higher education for certain children survivors of domestic violence deaths.

399.title: Establishes the State Police as the entity which is authorized to issue administrative subpoenas to internet service providers in cases of suspected child pornography
399.description: The purpose of this bill establishes the West Virginia State Police as the entity which is authorized to issue administrative subpoenas to Internet service providers in cases of suspected child pornography; to define offenses and set forth penalties and fees.

400.title: Providing for the expiration of the alternative minimum tax
400.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the expiration of the alternative minimum tax.

401.title: Relating to the annual school calendar
401.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the start of the instructional school term on August 21 and to provide greater flexibility for county school boards to meet the requirement that there be one hundred eighty instructional days in the annual school calendar.  The bill also provides for the scheduling of an additional noninstructional day prior to the commencement of the instructional term.

402.title: Updating the law governing professional licensing boards in general
402.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the law governing professional licensing boards in general.

403.title: Relating to inmate reimbursement for medical services provided to persons held in regional jails
403.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to assess charges against inmates for medical services.  The bill permits a reasonable copayment to be deducted directly from an inmate's trustee account for nonemergency medical treatment.

404.title: Relating to Public Defender Services and raising the hourly rate of compensation for panel attorneys
404.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the creation of public defender corporations in the fourth, sixteenth, seventeenth and twenty-sixth judicial circuits and to raise the hourly rate of compensation for panel attorneys.

405.title: Relating to unlawful expenditures by a local fiscal body
405.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that local fiscal bodies shall not be held personally or criminally liable for certain deficits caused by the unfunded actuarial accrued liability of the West Virginia Retiree Health Benefit Trust Fun or amounts for the annual required employer contribution over and above the minimum annual employer premium payment for other post-employment benefits.

406.title: Relating to trustee accounts and funds, earnings and personal property of inmates
406.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Commissioner of Corrections to place any interest or other sum of money (less than $10) which would have been credited to an inmate's account into the inmate benefit fund.  The bill would also allow the inmate benefit fund to be used for restitution of any negative balance on an inmate's trustee account.

407.title: Establishing a multi-disciplinary commission to study, make findings and recommendations regarding incarceration population and costs
407.description: The purpose of this bill is to request the Supreme Court of Appeals to establish a multi-disciplinary commission to study, make findings and recommendations regarding incarceration population and costs.

408.title: Providing that fire officers may use adjacent property to prevent fire from spreading
408.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that fire officers may use adjacent  property to prevent fire from spreading.

409.title: Exempting disabled veterans from campground rental fees during certain times
409.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt disabled veterans from campground rental fees from the day after Labor day until four days prior to Memorial Day.

410.title: Identifying salvia divinorum as a hallucinogen and adding it to the list of controlled substances
410.description: The purpose of this bill is to identify  salvia divinorum as an hallucinogen and to add it to the list of controlled substances.

411.title: Relating to exempting certain records of the Division of Corrections and Regional Jail Authority from the Freedom of Information Act that, if released, could aid inmates in committing unlawful acts
411.description: The purpose of this bill is to include information pertaining to the operation, staffing, equipping or escape and emergency contingency plans relating to any jail or correctional facility as exempt from disclosure where disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act would jeopardize the safe, secure and orderly operation of a jail or correctional facility.

412.title: Providing inmates a reduction in sentence for completion of education and rehabilitation programs
412.description: This bill authorizes the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to grant time off of the sentence for certain convicted inmates sentenced to confinement in a regional jail for completion of education and rehabilitation programs.

413.title: Relating to offenses by or against inmates
413.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that any inmate who engages in sexual assault of another inmate is guilty of a felony and, shall be confined for not less than fifteen years nor more than thirty-five years.  The bill further provides that any person not imprisoned who engages in sexual intercourse or sexual intrusion with an inmate is guilty of a felony and, shall be confined for not less than one year nor more than five years.

414.title: Clarifying what constitutes "on or about the person" regarding possession of a deadly weapon
414.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify what constitutes "on or about the person" regarding possession of a deadly weapon as within the possessor's immediate physical reach.

415.title: Reducing state income tax for state correctional officer retirees
415.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state correctional officers' retirement income from the federal adjusted gross income for calculating adjusted gross income for state income tax purposes.

416.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
416.title: Requiring contractors awarded state public works construction projects to meet time restrictions for the completion of a public works construction project
416.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require that each state public works contract include a provision requiring a definitive completion date and that contractors awarded such contracts be required to meet the time restriction.  The bill also defines "public works construction contract" and provides a monetary penalty for failure to complete a public works construction project on the agreed-upon completion date.  It also provides exceptions in which extensions may be granted while providing limitations upon an increase in the contract price or extension of time to complete a project in the event of change orders.  Finally, it directs the Secretary of the Department of Administration to propose legislative rules designed to implement the law.

417.title: Permitting magistrates to carry concealed handguns without a permit
417.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit magistrates to carry concealed handguns without a permit.

418.title: Increasing the amount of annual and incremental salary increases for eligible state employees
418.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of annual and incremental salary increases for eligible employees from $60 to $100.

419.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
419.title: Relating to treatment of income derived from federal military or federal police pensions that have been converted to federal civil service system pensions
419.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the West Virginia personal income tax to give retirement income derived from military pensions and from federal police pensions that have been converted into federal civil service pensions the same treatment that such income would have received if it had remained military retirement system income or federal police retirement system income.

420.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
420.title: Relating to the definition of "eligible veteran" for certain state training and employment preference benefits
420.description: The purpose of this bill is to include persons who served honorably in the National Guard and reserves as eligible veterans for preference in employment training and employment.

421.title: Relating to the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony
421.description: The purpose of this bill is the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony.

422.title: Agreement among the states to elect the president by national popular vote
422.description: The purpose of this bill is to enter West Virginia into an interstate compact known as the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.  Under the compact, the state agrees to award its electoral votes to the presidential ticket that receives the most popular votes in all 50 states and the District of Columbia.  The compact goes into effect when states cumulatively possessing a majority of the electoral votes have joined the compact.

423.title: Relating to monitoring of inmate telephone calls
423.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for disclosure of the recordings of inmates' telephone calls to law-enforcement agencies when disclosure is necessary for investigation, prevention or prosecution of a crime, as well as allowing for disclosure in civil or administrative proceedings in certain instances.  The bill would also allow for disclosure of inmates' mail to law-enforcement agencies when disclosure is necessary for the investigation, prevention or prosecution of a crime, as well as allowing for disclosure in civil or administrative proceedings in certain instances.

424.title: Establishing county and municipal authorities to provide for and maintain facilities to house Child Advocacy Centers
424.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish county and municipal authorities to provide for and maintain facilities to house Child Advocacy Centers.  Under the bill, a Child Advocacy Center is a safe place for multidisciplinary members to interview abused and neglected children at the same time.

425.title: Relating to annexation of unincorporated territory
425.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a minimum of 150 feet of contiguity for annexation by minor boundary adjustment; require a minimum of forty persons to petition for annexation without election; and allow any freeholder who owns twenty-five acres or more to opt out of any annexation.

426.title: Providing that a child born addicted to a controlled substance constitutes child abuse
426.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a child born addicted to a controlled substance constitutes child abuse.

427.title: Providing a tax credit for scholarship donations
427.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit for scholarship donations.

428.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
428.title: Prohibiting discrimination based upon age and sexual orientation
428.description: The purpose of this bill is to add "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodations. This bill also adds "age" and "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing.  It also defines "sexual orientation"  as "heterosexuality, bisexuality, homosexuality or gender identity or expression, whether actual or perceived".

429.title: Relating to child abuse and neglect
429.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit parents, guardians or custodians from allowing sexually violent predators and registered child abusers access to children.  The bill also defines key terms and makes technical changes for purposes of consistency.

430.title: Increasing the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits
430.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits of municipalities from five percent to six percent, with the increase being deposited into the Regional Jail Operations Partial Reimbursement Fund for distribution to counties.

431.title: Providing that adultery shall be a bar to alimony in a divorce proceeding
431.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that adultery be a bar to receiving alimony in a divorce proceeding.

432.title: Imposing certain conditions of probation of sex offenders convicted of failing to register
432.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose certain conditions of probation of sex offenders convicted of failing to register.

433.title: Adding one magistrate to Wood County
433.description: The purpose of this bill is to add one magistrate to Wood County.

434.title: Allowing a disabled veteran one additional license plate
434.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow disabled veterans an additional license plate.

435.title: Establishing a West Virginia State Trooper's Association leave donation program
435.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a leave donation program to allow members of the State Trooper's Association to donate accumulated leave time to the president and designee of the president of the State Trooper's Association.

436.title: Permitting retired state employees to transfer from Medicare to coverage through the West Virginia Public Employees Act
436.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit Medicare-eligible retired employees to transfer coverage from a Medicare-specific plan to coverage directly from the agency.

437.title: West Virginia Religious Freedom Act
437.description: The purpose of this bill is to  prevent government sponsored interference with a West Virginian's guaranteed freedom of religion.

438.last_action: To House  Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
438.title: Exempting all military income from personal income taxes
438.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all military income from personal income taxes beginning in 2009.

439.title: Relating to the spouse and dependent insurance coverage under the West Virginia Public Employees' Insurance Act
439.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend PEIA coverage for pregnancy related conditions to covered dependants.

440.title: Exempting the first twenty thousand dollars of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax
440.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the first $20,000 of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

441.title: Permitting the sale of nonintoxicating beer within three hundred feet from a church that consents to the sale
441.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a beer licensee to locate within three hundred feet of a church if agreed to by the church under certain circumstances.

442.title: Allowing the Supreme Court of Appeals to establish a uniform bail schedule
442.description: The purpose of this bill is to request the Supreme Court of Appeals to study the  establishment, administration and effect of a uniform bail schedule, and that the Supreme Court of Appeals report to the regular session of the Legislature, 2010, as to findings and any recommendations.

443.title: Including persons who participate in or who contribute to taking a person's identity with fraudulent intent
443.description: The purpose of this bill is to include persons who participate in or who contribute to taking a person's identity with fraudulent intent under the provisions of the criminal offense of taking the identity of another person.

444.title: Providing a statutory good faith exception to the exclusionary rule when evidence has been obtained during an execution of a search warrant, arrest warrant or capias
444.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a statutory good faith exception to the exclusionary rule when evidence has been obtained during an execution of a search warrant, arrest warrant or capias, which is later determined to be invalid, as long as the officer obtaining the evidence has relied in good faith on the search warrant, arrest warrant or capias.

445.title: Establishing threshold quantities of certain controlled substances to trigger prima facie evidence of intent to deliver if possessed by an individual
445.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish threshold quantities of certain controlled substances to trigger prima facie evidence of intent to deliver if possessed by an individual.

446.title: West Virginia Public Employment Relations Act
446.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the Public Employment Relations Act, designed to require public employers to recognize and engage in collective bargaining with labor unions representing public employees.

447.title: Requiring licensed tattoo artist to inform patrons, prior to performing the tattoo procedure, of the potential problems that a tattoo may cause in relation to the reading of magnetic resonance imaging
447.description: The purpose of this bill is to require licensed tattoo artists to inform patrons, prior to performing the tattoo procedure, of the potential problems that a tattoo may cause in relation to the clinical reading of magnetic resonance imaging studies, should the medical need for such studies ever arise.

448.title: Establishing the Silver Alert Plan, an alert system for missing cognitively impaired persons
448.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an alert system for persons with cognitive impairments to assist in finding these individuals before harm comes to them.

449.title: Prohibiting state funding for the distribution of holiday or greeting cards by elected officials, state employees, departments or agencies
449.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit state funding for the distribution of holiday or greeting cards by elected officials, state employees, departments or agencies.

450.title: Permitting county board of education the power to employ the most qualified person to be athletic and other extracurricular coaches
450.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit county boards of education the power to employ the most qualified person to be athletic and other extracurricular coaches. The bill also permits the boards to develop the criteria to be used when hiring and firing coaches.

451.title: Pay incentives for teachers who teach in their core field degree
451.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $2,000 pay incentive to teachers who teach in their core field degree.

452.title: Verifiable Science Act
452.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the public may request and shall receive, access under the state Freedom of Information Act to any purported scientific data used as the basis for proposed legislative rules or statutory enactments.

453.title: Allowing fireworks displays on public school property upon approval of the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshal
453.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow fireworks displays on public school property upon approval of the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshal.

454.title: Increasing compensation of membership of the West Virginia State Police
454.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase compensation for members of the West Virginia State Police.

455.title: West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act
455.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act.

456.title: Requiring that all houses, dwellings and businesses located in a district where public water service is made available for the first time after July 1, 2009, be connected to the public water service
456.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that all houses, dwellings and businesses located in a district where public water service is made available for the first time after July 1, 2009, be connected to the public water service.

457.title: Creating a tax credit for certain solar energy systems
457.description: The purpose of this bill is to give credit for energy savings when a solar energy system is installed on a residential property.

458.title: Authorizing professional licensing boards to combine administrative staff functions
458.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize professional licensing boards to combine administrative staff functions.

459.title: Relating to factors to be considered in granting grandparent visitation
459.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise the grandparent visitation statute to include additional factors for consideration including the child's relationship with the parent contesting grandparent visitation; any history of abuse by the parent, any criminal activity or history on the part of the parent and the amount of time the child spent with the grandparents prior to the absence of contact.

460.title: Providing arresting agency shall pay cost for the initial twenty-four hours of incarceration
460.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the arresting agency pays the cost incurred for the initial  twenty-four  hours of incarceration for each inmate they arrest and incarcerate. Additionally, the bill defines "arresting agency."

461.title: Requiring person incarcerated for sex offenses to register as such at the time they are incarcerated
461.description: The purpose of this bill is to require persons incarcerated for sex offenses to register as such at the time they are incarcerated.

462.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
462.title: Relating to the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"
462.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"; to define terms; to prohibit any person from obtaining, selling or receiving a person's telephone record without their consent; and to provide penalties.

463.title: Permitting employee and retiree organizations to obtain state employees' home addresses
463.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit employee and retiree organizations to obtain state employees' home addresses as an exception to the limitation imposed on the release of personal information concerning state employees and retirees.

464.title: Abolishing the business and franchise tax
464.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the business franchise tax effective July 1, 2009.

465.title: Exempting from taxation certain property owned by a nonprofit organization
465.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from taxation properties owned by a nonprofit organization which are used for housing college or university students, which is also used for religious or leadership training of college or university students.

466.title: Allowing state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conference for their children
466.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conferences for their children.

467.title: Limiting the exemption given to buildings used wholly as dwelling houses for no more than two families to those buildings only when owner-occupied
467.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the Fire Commission Rule adopting the Fire Code. The bill limits the exemption given to buildings used wholly as dwelling houses for no more than two families to those buildings only when owner-occupied.

468.title: Expanding applicability of increased penalties for crimes against certain protected persons
468.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the  applicability of increased criminal penalties for battery, malicious assault and unlawful assault against an government employee or contract worker to include all government workers and to expand this existing protection for health care workers to include contract health care workers .

469.title: Creating the Juvenile Services Reimbursement Offender Fund
469.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special revenue account in the State Treasury known as the Juvenile Services Offender Fund to facilitate reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Division of Juvenile Services in housing juvenile status offenders.

470.title: Correctional Industries Act of 2009
470.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the "Correctional Industries Act of 2009" by modernizing the provisions of the Prison-made Goods Act of 1939.  The bill also authorizes the creation of the Prison Industries Enhancement Programs provided by Title 18 U.S.C. 1761©.

471.title: Relating to classification of retail licenses for the sale of liquor
471.description: The purpose of this bill is to reclassify retail liquor licenses; to provide for licenses for free standing liquor stores and mixed retail liquor outlets; to provide a preference for free standing liquor stores; to set forth minimum requirements for each class of retail liquor license; to provide a purchase option for current retail licensees purchasing a retail license for a free standing liquor retail outlet; and to authorize the commission to offer financing for the purchase of a retail license for a free standing retail liquor outlet.

472.title: Making changes to the Municipal Home Rule Board
472.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the composition of the Municipal Home Rule Board and change the timetable and responsibilities for the Municipal Home Rule Pilot Program. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

473.title: Establishing a corporate tax credit up to fifty percent of the corporation's net income tax for contributions to scholarship funds
473.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to corporations of up to fifty percent of their primary tax liability for contributing to scholarship funds.

474.title: Granting a salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees
474.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant a salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees of $5,000 to be paid over a three-year period.

475.title: Capping regional jail per diem charges at forty-eight dollars and ten cents
475.description: The purpose of this bill is to cap the regional jail per diem charge to forty-eight dollars and ten cents per day, per inmate.

476.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
476.title: Providing that only healthy beverages and healthy or nutritional snacks may be sold in the county school system
476.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that only healthy beverages and healthy or nutritional snacks may be sold in the county school system.

477.title: Relating to persons who do not qualify for professional certificates who are issued certificates to serve in the public schools as athletic coaches
477.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow   persons employed in the public schools as athletic coaches or other extracurricular activities coaches, but who are not regular professional employees, to continue to be employed in the same position without the position being posted if they have served in the position for three years, receive satisfactory evaluations and are a college graduate, or if the coach is a high school graduate, then the coach shall have served in the position for five years and receive satisfactory evaluations.

478.title: Providing Good Friday as a state legal holiday
478.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that "Good Friday" is a state legal holiday.

479.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
479.title: Providing that persons convicted of certain drug related crimes must participate in a substance abuse counseling program to be eligible for probation
479.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that persons convicted of certain drug related crimes must participate in a substance abuse counseling program to be eligible for probation.

480.title: Making 911 emergency fees available to be used for both emergency and nonemergency calls
480.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter the definition of "county answering point" to mean a facility to which enhanced emergency telephone system calls for a county are initially routed for response, and where county personnel respond to specific requests for emergency or nonemergency service.  This would ensure that county personnel at county answering points also respond to specific requests for nonemergency services (i.e., all calls relating to ambulance, fire, police and emergency services) through the enhanced emergency telephone system. This, in turn, would permit funding of both emergency and nonemergency calls from 911 fees, saving counties money

481.title: Allowing the Superintendent of the State Police to charge a one hundred dollar motor vehicle inspection facility application fee
481.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Superintendent of the State Police to charge a fee of $100 to process a motor vehicle inspection facility application.

482.title: Relating to nonpartisan election of justices of the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and circuit court judges
482.description: The purpose of this bill is to elect all justices to the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and all circuit court judges on a nonpartisan basis.

483.title: Increasing penalties for financial exploitation of an elderly person or incapacitated adult
483.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for the financial exploitation of elderly persons and incapacitated adults.

484.title: Changing the way that the cost of incarcerating inmates in regional jails is collected
484.description: The purpose of this bill is to relieve the burden imposed on counties of incarcerating inmates in regional jails by changing the way that the cost of incarcerating inmates in regional jails is collected so that it is shared by the county, state and municipality where the alleged criminal act occurred; and making the cost of incarcerating a person for less than twenty-four hours one-half the amount charged for incarcerating an inmate for a full day.

485.title: Increasing penalties for failing to report child abuse
485.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase criminal penalties for failing to report child abuse.

486.title: Prohibiting any law enforcement or other official from interfering in the service of a warrant in child abuse investigations
486.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit any law enforcement or other official from interfering in the service of a warrant in child abuse investigations and to provide a penalty for violations including dismissal or forfeiture of office.

487.title: Waving tuition and fees for members of the WV State Police
487.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a waiver or reimbursement of tuition and fees for members of the West Virginia State Police attending institutions of higher education.

488.title: Compensating state troopers for call-back time
488.description: The purpose of this bill is to compensate state troopers for off-duty time when they are required to be on standby to be called back to work.

489.title: Prohibiting the use of cell phone and text-messaging devices while operating a motor vehicle except when using a hands-free device or in the case of an emergency
489.description: The purpose of this bill is to establishing the offense of unlawful use of a wireless communication device while operating a motor vehicle on a street or highway.  It provides exceptions and conditions for certain lawful uses and definitions.  It makes a violation a misdemeanor criminal offense with fine; and provides a limitation of enforcement.

490.title: Restricting public access to concealed weapons permit records
490.description: The purpose of this bill  is to restrict  public access to concealed weapons permit records .   The bill permits inspection of licenses by such persons as guardians of the licensee, executor or administrator, if licensee is deceased, attorney or other agent of licensee and law-enforcement agencies.

491.title: Relating to limitations for certain asbestos exposure claims
491.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit certain asbestos claims, provide for the fair and efficient judicial consideration of personal injury and wrongful death claims arising out of asbestos or silica exposure, to ensure that individuals who suffer impairment, now or in the future, from illnesses caused by exposure to asbestos or silica, receive compensation for their injuries, and for other purposes.

492.title: Establishing a work program for qualified inmates
492.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program for qualified inmates sentenced to a regional jail facility. It includes provisions specifying minimum requirements for the program.

493.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Corrections to keep track of repeat offenses committed by persons convicted of sexual offenses against children
493.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the commissioner of corrections to keep track of repeat offenses committed by persons convicted of sexual offenses against children.

494.title: Reverting the 911 fee on wireless telephones from three dollars to seventy-five cents
494.description: The purpose of this bill is to revert the 911 fee on wireless telephones from three dollars to seventy-five cents while reverting the distribution formula for 911 fees to a pro rata share of total fee revenues.

495.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
495.title: Protecting the privacy of a person's prescription information
495.description: The purpose of the bill is to protect the privacy of a person's prescription information.

496.title: Repealing article regulating male breeding animals
496.description: This bill removes outdated provisions from the code. Enacted in 1923, the provisions are no longer being used.

497.title: Authorizing use of citations in lieu of arrest warrants for certain offenses
497.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize law enforcement officers to use citations in lieu of arrest warrants for certain offenses, no longer requiring that a law enforcement officer personally witness a misdemeanor.

498.title: Relating to costs for housing inmates who are transferred to the custody of the division of corrections

499.title: Requiring state offices, agencies, boards and commissions to submit annual reports electronically
499.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state offices, agencies, boards and commissions to submit annual reports electronically with electronic copies also submitted to the Legislative Manager in certain circumstances.
