724.title: Relating to taxation of gambling and lottery winnings and losses
724.description: The purpose of this bill is to specify that gambling and lottery winnings are taxable and that gambling and lottery losses are tax deductible. The bill also requires the taxpayer to keep detailed records showing losses.

725.title: Requiring certain nonprofit directors and board members attend training
725.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all directors and members of the board of directors of nonprofit corporations that receive money from state agencies or that receive federal money through state agencies to participate in three hours of training.

726.title: Providing certain volunteer fire department members state income tax exemption
726.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption on state personal income tax to members of volunteer fire departments who meet certain qualified service requirements.

727.title: Providing certain corrections officers full retirement benefits
727.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers, parole officers and juvenile corrections officers may retire with full benefits after 20 years of actual and honorable service.

728.title: Providing certain State Teachers Retirement System annuitants state income tax exemption
728.description: The purpose of this bill is to  exempt the retirement benefits of certain annuitants under the State Teachers Retirement System from state income tax.

729.title: Allowing 2-year motorcycle registration period
729.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for an optional two-year registration period for motorcycles by collecting either one full year or two full years' fees. The bill also contains a provision to facilitate a change to expiration dates.

730.title: Expanding Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority territory
730.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the counties covered by West Virginia Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority to include Cabell, Mason and Jackson counties.

731.title: Requiring jobs impact statement for certain proposed legislation
731.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a jobs impact statement to be completed by the West Virginia Development Office for certain proposed legislation which may impact both short-term and long-term jobs in this state.

732.title: Limiting certain parks and recreation entities' liability
732.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the liability of the section of Parks and Recreation of the Division of Natural Resources, county parks and recreation commissions, boards of park and recreation commissioners and owners of land used for public parks and recreation purposes under an agreement with any of the foregoing entities.

733.title: Establishing penalties for manufacturing, selling or dispensing certain controlled substances causing death
733.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish penalties for any person who manufactures, sells or dispenses controlled drugs classified in Schedules I, II or II where a death results from the injection, inhalation or ingestion of the controlled substance.

734.title: Increasing certain Cultural Facilities and Capitol Resources Matching Grant Program Fund allocations
734.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of net terminal income allocated to the Cultural Facilities and Capitol Resources Matching Grant Program Fund.

735.title: Reducing ratio of school nurses to students
735.description: The purpose of this section is to provide a student-to-school nurse ratio of 1:750 in the school year 2009-2010 and to eliminate contracts between county boards of education and county health departments for equivalent nursing services.

736.title: Providing allocated Fire Protection Fund revenue to Fire Chiefs' and Fireman's Associations for certain expenses
736.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide State Treasury, Fire Protection Fund revenue to the West Virginia State Fire Chiefs' Association and the West Virginia State Fireman's Association, to be used for both associations' administration and training expenses, and to exempt both associations from eligibility and spending requirements under §8-15-8a and §8-15-8b.

737.title: Providing temporary detention of certain criminal suspects
737.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the temporary detention of criminal suspects by law-enforcement officers to inquire on commission of a crime where probable cause appears to exist.

738.title: Allowing federal adjusted gross income deduction for cost of certain high deductible health plan
738.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a federal adjusted gross income deduction for the amount spent on a high deductible health plan purchased in conjunction with a health savings account.

739.title: Relating to Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp Checkoff Program
739.description: The purpose of this bill is to include on the state personal income tax return a checkoff option to donate some or all of any tax refund to the "Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp  Checkoff Program"   for the operation of the camp.     This section is new; therefore, strike-throughs and underscoring have been omitted.

740.title: Requiring certain acupuncture treatment insurance coverage
740.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health insurance policies to cover acupuncture treatment performed by a licensed acupuncturist.

741.title: Increasing exemption on retirement income for certain retirees
741.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income in calculating the adjusted gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

742.title: Establishing Voluntary Retirement Accounts Program
742.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide every worker in the state with access to a voluntary retirement savings account through the state.

743.title: Increasing tax on alcohol purchases outside corporate municipal limits
743.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits of municipalities from five percent to ten percent.

744.title: Creating Physicians' Lien Act
744.description: The purpose of this bill is to    create a Physicians Lien Act to allow physicians and other providers to place liens on claims and causes of action by injured parties.

745.title: Requiring Commissioner of Public Health assess health impact of certain rules proposed by Department of Environmental Protection
745.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Bureau for Public Health to conduct a public health impact statement assessing the health impact of any new air or water rule, or modification of an existing air or water rule, proposed by the Department of Environmental Protection to insure that no air or water rule is promulgated without substantiating independent medical or scientific evidence that there is no detrimental public health impact from the rule.

746.title: Allowing paid sick leave to be used as paid family leave
746.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow employees to use paid accumulated sick leave for paid family leave to care for a family member.

747.title: Preventing reduction of disability pensions for certain Public Employees Retirement System members
747.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent a reduction in the annuity of a person who retires with disability retirement at age sixty-five.

748.title: Absolving landowner's liability for hunter's injuries
748.description: The purpose of this bill is to absolve the landowner, tenant or agent of the landowner from any civil liability for injuries to any persons hunting, trapping or fishing on the landowner's land with or without written permission.

749.title: Granting municipal courts jurisdiction over juveniles violating tobacco use laws
749.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant municipal courts jurisdiction over juveniles who violate laws and ordinances relating to tobacco use.

750.title: Relating to parental notification for unemancipated minor obtaining abortion
750.description: The purpose of this bill is relative to parental involvement in the minor's decision to obtain an abortion.  The bill requires physicians to obtain proof of age prior to the performance of an abortion on a pregnant woman.  The bill provides for a constructive notice to parents of minors, and maintains information for a specified period in the minor's medical file. The bill creates penalties.  the bill also provides for collection of fetal tissue in instances when the minor alleges sexual assault. Finally, the bill mandates specific reporting requirements.

751.title: Creating  Volunteer Firefighter Length of Service Act
751.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "West Virginia Volunteer Firefighter Length of Service Act"; and to provide that the State of West Virginia would have to provide for the administration costs during the first five years of the plan, after this time the plan should be self-sufficient to handle any associated administration costs.

752.title: Requiring employees selling alcohol take alcohol awareness course
752.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all employees of licensed private clubs and retail outlets selling alcoholic beverages to take the Techniques for Education and Alcohol Management (TEAM) course provided by the Alcoholic Beverage Commission.

753.title: Providing criminal penalty for parental controlled substance activity with child present
753.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a criminal penalty for a parent who engages in the manufacture, possession or distribution of a controlled substance while a child is present in the home.

754.title: Authorizing Attorney General to investigate and charge certain fuel price gouging
754.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Office of the Attorney General the power to investigate and charge home heating oil, gasoline or other motor fuel price gouging, at any time.

755.title: Allowing pharmacists to refuse dispensing certain abortion-related prescriptions
755.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow pharmacists and other individuals involved in dispensing medicines to refuse to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance that can be used as an abortifacient or that can be used as part of an abortion-related procedure.

756.title: Prohibiting certain state medical facilities from performing abortions
756.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit abortions at state college or university medical facilities, except when the abortion is necessary to save the life of the woman receiving the abortion.

757.title: Relating to land surveyor's liability upon entering railroad property
757.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow entry by land surveyors, at their own risk, onto railroad property for the purpose of ascertaining property boundaries.

758.title: Modifying low-income qualifier for senior citizens' homestead tax credit
758.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the qualifier for low income to three hundred percent or less of the federal poverty guideline from one hundred fifty percent or less of the federal poverty guideline for a senior citizens' homestead tax credit.

759.title: Requiring each magisterial district have equal number of members on county planning commissions
759.description: The purpose of this bill is to require equal numbers of members from each magisterial district on county planning commissions.

760.title: Requiring certain lenders register with Commissioner of Banking
760.description: The purpose of this bill is to require persons engaged in making consumer credit sales and certain other consumer related activities to register with the Commissioner of Banking instead of filing a notification with the Tax Division.  The bill sets forth registration form requirements and provides a registration fee. Under the bill, certain other organizations and individuals are exempted from the registration requirements.

761.title: Adding magistrate deputy clerk for Braxton County
761.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase, by one, the number of magistrate court deputy clerks that may be appointed and provide that the deputy clerk be appointed in Braxton County.

762.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection Secretary to sign National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permits
762.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to sign National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permits.

763.title: Placing Science and Cultural Center under General Services Division's authority
763.description: The purpose of this bill is to place the West Virginia Science and Cultural Center under the authority and control of the General Services Division of the Department of Administration.

764.title: Increasing fees for certain higher education students
764.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize each higher education governing board to increase fees of students taking more hours of course work than the number of hours of course work defined as full-time.

765.title: Allowing county commissions to regulate and restrict locations of video lottery establishments
765.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a county commission to provide by ordinance for regulation and restriction of the location of any premises in which a limited video lottery retailer holds a license.

766.title: Relating to abandoned vehicles generally
766.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor offense to abandon a motor vehicle which is unlicensed or inoperable or both, upon any private property for a period of more than thirty days, unless the vehicle is in an enclosed building, with certain exceptions.

767.title: Requiring women seeking abortion opportunity to view fetus ultrasound image
767.description: The purpose of this bill is to require every woman seeking an abortion to be given the opportunity to see an ultrasound image of the fetus.  The bill also prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of the section.  It also provides that nothing in the section can be construed as approving of abortion.

768.title: Modifying circumstances which relieve certain directors from civil liability
768.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the circumstances under which a qualified director is relieved from civil liability. The bill specifies that the protection from liability does not apply to a qualified director if he or she is found to have intentionally caused damage or injury to another in the performance of his or her duties.

769.title: Prohibiting sales and possession of certain raffle boards and games
769.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the possession of certain gambling devices by persons not authorized by law to sell or possess such devices, by declaring them contraband and extending the authority of the State Tax Department Criminal Investigation Division to seize such games.

770.title: Exempting certain amount of state pensions and Social Security benefits from state income tax
770.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the first $10,000 of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax with an increase to $15,000 for retirees who are sixty-five years old or older.

771.title: Requiring abortion-related statistics' collection
771.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the collection of statistics relative to abortions performed in the state.

772.title: Limiting Social Security number requirement in securing state services
772.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement of the use of a social security number in securing any state services or assistance.

773.title: Awarding National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to certain teachers
773.description: The purpose of this bill is to pay the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to the holders of certificates awarded to them during employment as a classroom teacher if they are subsequently employed as a school principal, or assistant school principal, or in another position in an instructional leadership capacity.

774.title: Relating to certain school coaches' requirements
774.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow   persons   to continue   as athletic coaches or coaches of other extracurricular activities

775.title: Allowing blasting program penalties' deposit in Special Reclamation Fund
775.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow penalties collected under the Department of Environmental Protection's blasting program to be deposited in the Special Reclamation Fund.

776.title: Requiring principals take responsibility and control over teacher's classroom performance
776.description: The purpose of this bill is to require principals to take on greater authority and control over teachers' classroom teaching performance.  Toward this goal the bill requires the State Board of Education to propose rules for legislative approval designed to develop and implement a program to train principals to act with greater control and authority over the teachers in their schools in a manner similar to corporate CEOs in order to maintain higher standards in the classroom and promote constant professional improvement of teachers.

777.title: Providing certain retirees personal income tax adjustment
777.description: The purpose of this bill to extend the termination of a personal income tax adjustment to the gross income of certain retirees receiving pensions from defined pension plans that terminated and are being paid a reduced maximum benefit guarantee from 2007 to 2014.

778.title: Increasing benefits of certain retired state personnel
778.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase benefits of certain retired state personnel, who have been retired for five years or longer, by three percent in July, 2009, and then increase the benefits by three percent every five years thereafter.

779.title: Increasing penalties for underage use or possession of tobacco
779.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for use or possession of tobacco or tobacco products by a person under eighteen years of age.  The bill increases fines and community service requirements, and upon a second offense, provides for revocation of the person's junior or graduated driver's license until the minor attains eighteen years of age, or if the person does not yet have a junior or graduated driver's license, the person is ineligible to apply for any type of driver's license until the minor attains eighteen years of age.

780.title: Increasing deposit from State Excess Lottery Revenue Fund to Higher Education Improvement Fund
780.description: The purpose of this bill is  to increase the amount from the State Excess Lottery Revenue Fund that is deposited each fiscal year into the Higher Education Improvement Fund for higher education from $10 million to $15 million.

781.title: Authorizing allocated revenues to fund volunteer firemen pensions
781.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain revenues may be allocated to fund pensions for volunteer firemen in order to improve recruitment and retention of volunteer firemen.

782.title: Providing public employees retirement credit for armed forces service
782.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that any service in the United States Armed Forces up to five years is credited service toward retirement for members of the Public Employees Retirement System.

783.title: Relating to school employees' donated personal leave days
783.description: The purpose of this bill is to lay out the procedure for county school boards to return unused donated personal leave days back to the donors.

784.title: Allocating funding for transporting students to certain activities
784.description: The purpose of this bill is to allocate $15,000 to each county to be used for transporting students to school related activities within the state; requires approval in advance from superintendent of schools for the county making the request; forfeiture of unused funds.

785.title: Increasing public employees retirement annuity multiplier
785.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the multiplier for a retirement annuity in the public employees retirement system from two to two and one-quarter percent.  The bill also deletes language found to be void by the Supreme Court of Appeals.

786.title: Increasing benefits of certain retired teachers
786.description: The purpose of this bill is to give retired teachers who have been retired for five years or longer, an increase in retirement benefits by three percent in July, 2009, and then increase the benefits by three percent every five years thereafter.

787.title: Removing scholarship funds' cap for dependent children of deceased State Police
787.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the cap on scholarship funds for surviving dependent children of certain deceased members of the West Virginia State Police.

788.title: Exempting certain professional and personal services from consumers sales and service tax
788.description: The purpose of this bill is to list certain professional and personal services that are exempt from the payment of the consumers sales tax.

789.title: Providing automatic court-ordered transfer of marital property upon divorce decree
789.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the automatic court-ordered transfer of title to marital property upon a decree of divorce.

790.title: Prohibiting dispensing of public moneys within 90 days of election
790.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit distribution, handing out or otherwise dispensing of public moneys by elected officials within ninety days of elections. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

791.title: Allowing county school boards' substitute service personnel placement flexibility
791.description: The purpose of this bill is to give county school superintendents more flexibility and ease in placing service personnel workers in positions of need on a day-to-day basis.

792.title: Establishing alcohol use by minors as juvenile delinquent offense
792.description: The purpose of this bill is to make §11-16-19 and §49-1-4 consistent with prior amendments to the code which changed the use of alcoholic beverages by minors from a status offense to a juvenile delinquent offense.

793.title: Prohibiting state funding of abortions
793.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit state funding of abortions.

794.title: Requiring insurers provide full autism spectrum disorder coverage
794.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health insurers to provide full coverage for the prevention, early detection, diagnosis and treatment of autism spectrum disorder.

795.title: Relating to special license plates
795.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue "Patriot Guard Riders" license plates for passenger vehicles and motorcycles.

796.title: Requiring Public Service Commission promulgate wind power projects' rules
796.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Public Service Commission to promulgate rules relating to wind power projects.

797.title: Awarding National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to certain school leaders
797.description: The purpose of this bill is to pay the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to the holders of certificates awarded to them during employment as a classroom teacher if they are subsequently employed as a school principal, assistant school principal or in another position in an instructional leadership capacity.

798.title: Increasing certain Division of Corrections' employees salaries and increment pay
798.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the incremental salary for Division of Corrections; to provide salary increase for every employee of the Division of Corrections  ;     and to   provide a $2009 salary increase for every employee of the Division of Corrections.

799.title: Creating State Police Higher Education Security Act
799.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia State Police Higher Education Security Act.

800.title: Providing certain animal cruelty protections
800.description: The purpose of this bill is to prescribe minimum requirements relative to tethering or chaining animals, including the length and weight of chains or tethering devices, as well as other requirements, all of which are intended to protect animals from cruel treatment.

801.title: Authorizing municipalities to provide free parking for certain veterans
801.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow municipalities to provide for free parking for certain veterans.

802.title: Creating life insurance reimbursement fund for National Guard members
802.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a fund to reimburse group life insurance premiums paid by members of the National Guard in exchange for and in recognition of their  service in this state and their assumption of extended periods of active duty in combat areas.

803.title: Increasing relocation expense allocation for State Police
803.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the relocation expense allocation for members of the West Virginia State Police when the transfer necessitates relocation of the member's family  .

804.title: Creating Asbestos Claims Transparency Act
804.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a procedure that requires a claimant that files an asbestos case after the effective date of this bill to provide information to all defendants about all claims filed or anticipated to be filed by that claimant against asbestos bankruptcy trusts, a mechanism for the defendant to challenge those claims, a procedure for sanctions by the court, and for set-offs for those claims.

805.title: Creating Transition Program for Tobacco Farmers
805.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a system   to assist farmers to make the transition from growing tobacco to growing other crops or pursuing other agricultural endeavors.  The bill includes provisions which create the "Transition Program for Tobacco Farmers" as well as the "Transition Program for Tobacco Farmers' Fund."  The bill also provides for use of the Tobacco Settlement Fund for the program.

806.title: Limiting real property classification of managed timberland
806.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit classification of real property as managed timberland to prevent county property tax revenues from decreasing by more than four percent.

807.title: Allowing federal adjusted gross income deduction for health insurance expenses
807.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a federal adjusted gross income deduction of up to $15,000 for the amount spent on health insurance.

808.title: Redefining "all-terrain vehicle" to include all-terrain utility vehicles
808.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the definition of all-terrain vehicle to include all-terrain utility vehicles.

810.title: Authorizing municipalities to enter into energy-savings contracts
810.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize municipalities to enter into contracts for energy-saving contracts.  Current law only allows the state and its agencies to do this. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

811.title: Relating to private investments for Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park
811.description: The purpose of this bill is to attract private investment for financing, construction and operation of additional public cottages at Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park.  The bill authorizes and directs the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate rules regarding the granting of long-term lodging unit usage and related rights and privileges to private parties on commercially reasonable terms that are deemed appropriate, desirable or necessary by the Director to attract additional private investment for such purposes.

812.title: Permitting Commissioner of Highways to transfer surplus balances between funds
812.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the Commissioner of Highways to transfer surplus cash balances between funds to cover temporary cash flow needs provided the originating fund is not impaired and the receiving fund gives a credit to the originating fund.

814.title: Relating to handicapped parking violations
814.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that accessible parking (formerly referred to as handicapped parking) violations will be considered motor vehicle violations and criminal offenses for certain penalty and record keeping purposes.

815.title: Authorizing certain Alcohol Beverage Control employees to have arrest powers and carry concealed weapons
815.description: The purpose of this bill is to  authorize the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner and certain employees to have arrest powers; and to authorize the  carrying of a concealed weapon while performing his or her official duties.

816.title: Sentencing discretion for certain youthful offenders
816.description: The purpose of this bill is to give a circuit judge discretion to impose the original sentence on a youthful offender who has successfully completed a youthful offender training program but who has been charged with committing another crime between his or her release from the youthful offender center and the sentencing hearing.

817.title: Allowing school districts certain substitute teacher hiring flexibility in critical need areas
817.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow school districts flexibility in hiring specialty substitutes for critical need areas.

818.title: Prohibiting ATMs in video lottery establishments
818.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the placement of Automated Teller Machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals.

819.title: Providing certain ventilator patients Medicaid coverage
819.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide Medicaid coverage for ventilator patient care at health facilities and to update the certificate of need standards applicable to ventilator services.

820.title: Relating to jury selection
820.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow both the accused and prosecuting attorney to have four strikes from a panel of potential jurors.

821.title: Clarifying basis for prospective juror disqualification
821.description: The purpose of this bill is to replace the phrase "other infamous offense" with better defined criteria as the basis for disqualification of prospective jurors; the criteria mirrors the matters for which a witness at trial may be impeached.

822.title: Relating to mortgage loan procedures generally
822.description: The purpose of this bill is to make changes to the disclosure requirements regarding fees in a mortgage loan, grant the commissioner the authority to issue a provisional mortgage license and to change time frame for hearings.

823.title: Providing Division of Banking notification of state banks' and holding companies' applications for out-of-state bank acquisitions
823.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit West Virginia state banks or bank holding companies to acquire out-of-state banks and bank holding companies.

824.title: Exempting Social Security income from state income tax
824.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security income from state income tax.

825.title: Requiring defendants pay certain incarceration costs
825.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a court to conduct a hearing at the time it sentences a defendant to jail to determine the defendant's ability to pay the costs of the defendant's incarceration.  The bill requires the court to require the defendant to pay for up to thirty days of incarceration in jail if it finds the defendant is or will be able in the foreseeable future to pay.

826.title: Extending civil liability immunity to parks and recreation districts' operators
826.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend immunity from civil liability to the operators of parks and recreation districts.

827.title: Exempting insurance burial policies from Medicaid assignment
827.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt insurance burial policies from assignment by Medicaid recipients to the Department of Health and Human Resources.

828.title: Requiring Legislative Auditor evaluate Secondary Schools Activities Commission
828.description: The purpose of this bill subjects the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission to evaluation by the Legislative Auditor and requires board members and officers to comply with ethical standards for elected and appointed officials.

829.title: Creating Municipal Roads and Bridges Repair Fund
829.description: The purpose of this bill is to  create a fund for the repair of bridges in Class III and Class IV municipalities when there is an immediate need for the repairs.  The bill provides for administration by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority.

830.title: Rescinding student financial assistance due to certain alcohol or drug violations
830.description: The purpose of this bill is to rescind state financial assistance from students   who receive two or more citations for an open container violation, DUI, underage consumption, public intoxication or contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

831.title: Relating to teachers' professional development and preparation days
831.description: The purpose of this bill is to  add two days to the employment term for teachers to be used for professional development; change instructional support and enhancement days into professional development days; and allow more of certain days to be scheduled prior to August 26 for the purposes of preparing for the opening of school and staff development.

832.title: Prohibiting smoking in motor vehicle when child under 14 is present
832.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of lit tobacco products in a motor vehicle while individuals fourteen years of age or under are present.

833.title: Providing penalties for failure to report to Alzheimer's Disease Registry
833.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide penalties for failure to report under the provisions of this section.

834.title: Providing certain retired conservation officers'  state income tax exemption
834.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions from state income tax law.

835.title: Preserving criminal case biological evidence
835.description: The purpose of this bill is to preserve any biological evidence in connection with a criminal case so that the evidence is available for DNA testing when a convicted felon makes a written motion for DNA testing on the basis that the felon was not the perpetrator of the crime as provided under the DNA testing provisions of §15-2B-14 of this code.  The bill also provides a felony penalty for willful and intentional violations.

836.title: Setting imprisonment term for malicious assault on certain officers
836.description: The purpose of this bill is to set the term of incarceration for a person convicted of malicious assault on a police officer and others who are acting in an official capacity at ten years.

837.title: Increasing maximum weight for six-axle tractor trailers
837.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the maximum weight amount for trucks equipped with six axles and two additional brakes to ninety-seven thousand pounds.

838.title: Setting school athletic director standards
838.description: The purpose of this bill is to set standards for school athletic directors.  The bill also requires a high school to assign a full-time athletic director if the school has thirteen or more varsity sports, and at least a half-time athletic director if the school has twelve or less varsity sports.

839.title: Authorizing Board of Risk and Insurance Management to provide certain airports' insurance
839.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Board of Risk and Insurance Management to provide insurance to county and regional airport authorities and municipal airports.

840.title: Creating Nursing Education Forgivable Loan Program
840.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a loan forgiveness program for nurses similar to what currently exists for medical doctors and osteopathic physicians.

841.title: Compensating State Police for call-back time
841.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that State Police officers be compensated for time when they are required to be on standby so that they may be called back to work if necessary.

842.title: Requiring boards of education hire best qualified candidate for extracurricular activities
842.description: The purpose of this bill is to require boards of education to hire the best qualified person for extracurricular activities.

843.title: Providing single resident hunting, fishing and trapping license
843.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a single resident license for all hunting, fishing and trapping.  The bill also would dedicate each fiscal year one percent of all revenue in the General Revenue Fund to DNR.

844.title: Allowing emergency medical technicians to administer epinephrine
844.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit emergency medical technicians to administer epinephrine to patients to treat allergic reaction and anaphylaxis.

845.title: Relating to War on Terrorism Service Medal license plate
845.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a "War on Terrorism Service Medal" license plate displaying the "War on Terrorism Service Medal" logo.

846.title: Requiring background checks on real estate licensing applicants
846.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the criminal history check of applicants for real estate licenses.

847.title: Relating to Infrastructure and Jobs Development Council
847.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the planning, construction, and expansion of new or existing water, sewer, gas, telecommunication lines or facilities and other infrastructure in conjunction with the construction of the new roads projects and to provide a tax credit for taxpayers assisting in the completion of projects recommended by the council and associated roads.

848.title: Prohibiting handheld cellular phone use while driving
848.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of handheld cellular telephones while driving and to provide a penalty for violations.  Under the bill, a person may be fined for a violation, but no points may be assessed against his or her driver's license.

849.title: Dedicating certain severance tax portion to counties and municipalities
849.description: The purpose of this bill is to dedicate five percent of every $1 million of certain severance taxes for the use and benefit of the counties and municipalities from which those taxes were generated.

850.title: Providing certain medical providers tax credit
850.description: The purpose of this bill is to  provide a tax credit to medical providers in an amount equal to their investment in electronic medical record technology.

851.title: Relating to unlawful discriminatory practices generally
851.description: The purpose of this bill is to add "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodations. This bill also adds "age" and "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing.  It defines "sexual orientation" as "heterosexuality, bisexuality, homosexuality or gender identity or expression, whether actual or perceived"; and adds to §5-11A-3 a definition of "age" as meaning the age of forty or above .

852.title: Providing certain fetuses anesthesia
852.description: The purpose of this bill is to require medical facilities that provide abortions to administer anesthesia to an unborn fetus when aborted, if it is older than seven weeks.  It also provides that when, during the course of an abortion procedure, a fetus is aborted alive, all available medical means must be used to preserve its life.  The bill provides criminal penalties for violations.

853.title: Relating to nonpartisan election of Supreme Court justices
853.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow Supreme Court justices to be elected on a nonpartisan ballot.

854.title: Regulating all-terrain vehicles' use
854.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose regulations on the use and operation of all-terrain vehicles.  The bill prohibits operation on paved roads and provides for regulation of all-terrain vehicles by local government authorities.

855.title: Prohibiting gender-based abortions
855.description: The purpose of this bill is to  prohibit the performance of any abortion when the woman seeking it is doing so solely on account of the gender of the fetus.  The bill also prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of the section.

856.title: Prohibiting straw purchases of firearms
856.description: The purpose of this bill is to  prohibit "straw purchases" of firearms in which a person ineligible under federal law to purchase or possess a firearm attempts to purchase a firearm from a firearm dealer through a third party who is not ineligible. This bill also conforms certain definitions to federal law.

857.title: Prohibiting subsidies to entities performing abortions
857.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit subsidies to entities that perform abortions.

858.title: Requiring advance notice of negative credit reports
858.description: The purpose of this bill is to compel consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of negative credit reports to allow consumers an opportunity to correct any discrepancies before the report is relied upon by a potential creditor.  The bill provides for a cause of action for violations and subjects consumer reporting agencies violating the provisions of the bill to a civil penalty.

859.title: Relating to Tourism Development Act
859.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a tax incentive for the creation, construction or enlargement of tourism attractions or amenities.  The credit operates to allow the taxpayer to recover up to twenty-five percent or, in the case of bed and breakfast facilities, fifty percent, of qualified eighty percent investment in a tourism attraction or amenity by offsetting up to eighty percent of consumers sales and service tax collected by the taxpayer from customers over a period of either five or ten years at the election of the taxpayer.

860.title: Increasing certain criminal trespassing penalties
860.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase penalties for certain criminal trespassing offenses.

861.title: Increasing Employee Suggestion Award Board's cash award limit
861.description: The purpose of this bill is to: (1) Increase the maximum cash award the Employee Suggestion Award Board may make for an individual award to $16,000; (2) Require the Board to report to the Legislature every five years the amount the maximum award amount would need to be adjusted to compensate for inflation and give its recommendation, if any, addressing the amount the maximum award amount should be changed; and (3) Allow the Governor to make a secondary award of up to $5,000 for suggestions the Board has approved if the suggestion is implemented in one or more additional state agencies.

862.title: Divesting state money from companies doing business in countries sponsoring terrorist activities
862.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove all state money from investments with companies that do business with or in countries engaging in terrorist activities.

863.title: Creating DNA samples database from felony arrests
863.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow DNA samples to be taken from arrested persons and to provide a database of persons arrested for felonies to aid in solving crimes.

864.title: Deleting provision banning weapons on State Capitol property
864.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the prohibition on bringing weapons upon the State Capitol complex and clarify the courthouse carry ban to exclude parts of building one of the State Capitol that do not house Supreme Court of Appeals offices.

865.title: Clarifying concealed handgun license reciprocity
865.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve the concealed handgun license reciprocity process by recognizing any concealed handgun license issued by any other state to a nonresident of this state without the requirement of a reciprocity agreement or recognition of West Virginia permits by the other state as a condition of such recognition.  This bill would continue statutory authorization for the Attorney General to negotiate and execute reciprocity agreements with other states as necessary to secure the recognition of West Virginia concealed handgun licenses in as many other states as possible.  Current §61-7-5, relating to the revocation of licenses, is repealed and consolidated into §61-7-4(m).

866.title: Creating misdemeanor offense of interference with treatment of injured railroad employee
866.description: The purpose of this bill is to create criminal penalties for a railroad company or employee who denies, delays or interferes with medical treatment or first-aid to a railroad employee injured on the job, or who threatens discipline to an injured employee who requests medical treatment or first-aid for a job injury.

868.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to permits for construction, modification, relocation and operation of stationary sources of air pollutants
868.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Permits for Construction, Modification, Relocation and Operation of Stationary Sources of Air Pollutants; Notification Requirements; Administrative Updates; Temporary Permits; General Permits; Permission to Commence Construction; and Procedures for Evaluation.

869.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to permits for construction and major modification of major stationary sources of air pollution for the prevention of significant deterioration
869.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Permits for Construction and Major Modification of Major Stationary Sources of Air Pollution for the Prevention of Significant Deterioration.

870.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rules
870.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Standards of Performance for New Stationary Sources.

871.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to control of air pollution from hazardous waste treatment, storage and disposal facilities
871.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Control of Air Pollution from Hazardous Waste Treatment, Storage or Disposal Facilities.

872.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to emission standards for hazardous air pollutants
872.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants.

873.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to mercury budget training program to reduce mercury emissions
873.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to a Mercury Budget Training Program to Reduce Mercury Emissions.

874.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to ambient air quality standards
874.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Ambient Air Quality Standards.

875.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to hazardous waste management systems
875.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Hazardous Waste Management Systems.

876.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to assessment of civil administrative penalties
876.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Assessment of Civil Administrative Penalties.

877.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to hazardous waste management fee
877.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Hazardous Waste Management Fee.

878.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to state water pollution control revolving fund
878.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the State Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.

879.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to environmental laboratories' certification and standards of performance
879.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Environmental Laboratories Certification and Standards of Performance.

880.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to dam safety
880.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Dam Safety.

882.title: Authorizing Ethics Commission promulgate legislative rule relating to employment exemptions
882.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Employment Exemptions.

883.title: Authorizing Ethics Commission promulgate legislative rule relating to lobbying
883.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Lobbying.

884.title: Authorizing Ethics Commission promulgate legislative rule relating to filing of verified time records.
884.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Filing of Verified Time Records.

885.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board promulgate legislative rule relating to benefit determination and appeal
885.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Benefit Determination and Appeal.

886.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board promulgate legislative rule relating to Teachers Retirement System
886.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Teachers' Retirement System.

887.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board promulgate legislative rule relating to Public Employees Retirement System
887.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Public Employees Retirement System.

888.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board promulgate legislative rule relating to refund, reinstatement, retroactive service and loan interest factors
888.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Refund, Reinstatement, Retroactive Service and Loan Interest Factors.

889.title: Authorizing Department of Administration promulgate legislative rules
889.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Service Credit for Accrued and Unused Sick and Annual Leave.

890.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board promulgate legislative rule relating to the State Police
890.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the West Virginia State Police.

891.title: Authorizing Commission for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing promulgate legislative rule relating to establishment of required qualifications and ethical standards for interpreters and transliterators
891.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commission for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Establishment of Required Qualifications and Ethical Standards for Interpreters and Transliterators.

892.title: Authorizing Board of Dental Examiners promulgate legislative rule relating to board
892.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Dental Examiners to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Board.

893.title: Authorizing Board of Dental Examiners promulgate legislative rule relating to formation and approval of dental corporations
893.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Dental Examiners to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Formation and Approval of Dental Corporations.

894.title: Authorizing Department of Administration promulgate legislative rule relating to fair market price determination
894.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Fair Market Price Determination.

895.title: Authorizing Department of Administration promulgate legislative rule relating to statewide contracts
895.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Statewide Contracts.

896.title: Authorizing Department of Administration promulgate legislative rule relating to qualifications for participation
896.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Qualifications for Participation.

897.title: Authorizing Commissioner of Agriculture promulgate legislative rule relating to animal disease control
897.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Animal Disease Control.

898.title: Authorizing Commissioner of Agriculture promulgate legislative rule relating to disposal of dead poultry
898.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Disposal of Dead Poultry.

899.title: Authorizing Commissioner of Agriculture promulgate legislative rule relating to commercial feed
899.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Commercial Feed.

900.title: Authorizing Commissioner of Agriculture promulgate legislative rule relating to schedule of charges for inspection services: Fruit
900.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to a Schedule of Charges for Inspection Services: Fruit.

901.title: Authorizing Board of Architects promulgate legislative rule relating to registration of architects
901.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Architects to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Registration of Architects.

902.title: Authorizing Board of Architects promulgate legislative rule relating to fees for registration of architects
902.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Architects to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Fees for Registration of Architects.

903.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate legislative rule relating general provisions
903.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to General Provisions.

904.title: Authorizing Consolidated Public Retirement Board promulgate legislative rule relating to Deputy Sheriff Retirement System
904.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System.

905.title: Authorizing Board of Accountancy promulgate legislative rule relating to the board and rules of professional conduct
905.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Accountancy to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Board and Rules of Professional Conduct.

906.title: Authorizing Department of Administration promulgate legislative rule relating to Purchasing Division
906.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Purchasing Division.

907.title: Authorizing Department of Administration promulgate legislative rule relating to parking
907.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Parking.

908.title: Authorizing Ethics Commission promulgate legislative rule relating to purchase, sale or lease of personal property
908.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Purchase, Sale or Lease of Personal Property.

909.title: Authorizing Ethics Commission promulgate legislative rule relating to interest in public contracts
909.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Interest in Public Contracts.

910.title: Authorizing Ethics Commission promulgate legislative rule relating to voting
910.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Voting.

911.title: Authorizing Department of Health and Human Resources promulgate legislative rule relating to licensure of medical adult day care centers
911.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Licensure of Medical Adult Day Care Centers.

912.title: Authorizing Department of Health and Human Resources promulgate legislative rules
912.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Public Water Systems.

913.title: Authorizing Department of Health and Human Resources promulgate legislative rule relating to tuberculosis testing, control treatment and commitment
913.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Tuberculosis Testing, Control Treatment and Commitment.

914.title: Authorizing Division of Human Services promulgate legislative rule relating to child care center licensing
914.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Human Services to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Child Care Center Licensing.

915.title: Authorizing Insurance Commissioner promulgate legislative rule relating to continuing education for individual insurance producers
915.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Insurance Commissioner to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Continuing Education for Individual Insurance Producers.

916.title: Authorizing Insurance Commissioner promulgate legislative rule relating to preneed life insurance minimum standards for determining reserve liabilities and nonforfeiture values
916.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Insurance Commissioner to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Preneed Life Insurance Minimum Standards for Determining Reserve Liabilities and Nonforfeiture Values.

917.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to packaging and labeling
917.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Packaging and Labeling.

918.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to method of sale of commodities
918.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to a Method of Sale of Commodities.

919.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to standards for weights and measures inspectors' adoption of National Conference of Weights and Measures Handbook
919.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Standards for Weights and Measures Inspectors' Adoption of National Conference of Weights and Measures (NCWM) Handbook 130, 1987 Edition.

920.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to Amusement Rides and Attractions Safety Act
920.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Amusement Rides and Attractions Safety Act.

921.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to Manufactured Housing Construction and Safety Standards Board
921.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the West Virginia Manufactured Housing Construction and Safety Standards Board.

922.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to Elevator Safety Act
922.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Elevator Safety Act.

923.title: Authorizing Division of Labor promulgate legislative rule relating to weights and measures calibration fees
923.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Labor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Weights and Measures Calibration Fees.

924.title: Authorizing Board of Medicine promulgate legislative rule relating to definition of surgery
924.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Definition of Surgery.

925.title: Authorizing Board of Medicine promulgate legislative rule relating to licensure, disciplinary and complaint procedures
925.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Licensure, Disciplinary and Complaint Procedures; Continuing Education; and Physician Assistants.

926.title: Authorizing Board of Medicine promulgate legislative rule relating to establishment and regulation of restricted license issued to applicant in extraordinary circumstances
926.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Establishment and Regulation of a Restricted License Issued to an Applicant in Extraordinary Circumstances.

927.title: Authorizing Division of Motor Vehicles promulgate legislative rule relating to denial, suspension, revocation, restriction or nonrenewal of driving privileges
927.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Denial, Suspension, Revocation, Restriction or Nonrenewal of Driving Privileges.

928.title: Authorizing Division of Motor Vehicles promulgate legislative rule relating to collection of tax on sale of motor vehicle
928.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Collection of the Tax on the Sale of a Vehicle.

929.title: Authorizing Division of Natural Resources promulgate legislative rule relating to boating
929.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Boating.

930.title: Authorizing Division of Natural Resources promulgate legislative rule relating to deer hunting
930.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Deer Hunting.

931.title: Authorizing Division of Natural Resources promulgate legislative rule relating to lifetime hunting, trapping and fishing licenses
931.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Lifetime Hunting, Trapping and Fishing Licenses.

932.title: Authorizing Division of Natural Resources promulgate legislative rule relating to lifetime hunting, trapping and fishing license and stamp fees
932.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Lifetime Hunting, Trapping and Fishing License and Stamp Fees.

933.title: Authorizing Division of Personnel promulgate legislative rule relating to reimbursement of compensation paid to state employees for training, education and professional development
933.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Personnel to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Reimbursement of Compensation Paid to State Employees for Training, Education and Professional Development.

934.title: Authorizing Board of Physical Therapy promulgate legislative rule relating to general provisions
934.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Physical Therapy to promulgate a legislative rule relating to General Provisions.

935.title: Authorizing Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority promulgate legislative rule relating to criteria and procedures for determination of projected cost per day for incarcerated inmates
935.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Criteria and Procedures for Determination of Projected Cost per Day for Inmates Incarcerated in Regional Jails Operated by the Authority.

936.title: Authorizing Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses promulgate legislative rule relating to policies, standards and criteria for evaluation and accreditation of colleges, departments or schools of nursing
936.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Policies, Standards and Criteria for the Evaluation and Accreditation of Colleges, Departments or Schools of Nursing.

937.title: Authorizing Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses promulgate legislative rule relating to limited prescriptive authority for nurses in advance practice
937.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Examiners for Registered Professional Nurses to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Limited Prescriptive Authority for Nurses in Advanced Practice.

938.title: Authorizing Division of Rehabilitation Services promulgate legislative rule relating to low vision driver training program
938.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Rehabilitation Services to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Low Vision Driver Training Program.

939.title: Authorizing Board of Respiratory Care promulgate legislative rule relating to student temporary permits
939.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Respiratory Care to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Student Temporary Permits.

940.title: Authorizing Secretary of State promulgate legislative rule relating to administration of address confidentiality program
940.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Secretary of State to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Administration of the Address Confidentiality Program.

941.title: Authorizing Board of Social Work Examiners promulgate legislative rule relating to fee schedule
941.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Social Work Examiners to promulgate a legislative rule relating to a Fee Schedule.

942.title: Authorizing State Tax Department promulgate legislative rule relating to combined returns pursuant to investigation by Tax Commissioner
942.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Combined Returns Pursuant to an Investigation by the Tax Commissioner.

943.title: Authorizing State Tax Department promulgate legislative rule relating to film industry investment tax credit
943.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to combined returns pursuant to the Film Industry Investment Tax Credit.

944.title: Authorizing Department of Revenue promulgate legislative rules
944.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Repeal of Valuation of Intangible Personal Property Including Stock Accounts Receivable and Stock in Banks and Capital of Savings and Loan Associations.

945.title: Authorizing Department of Environmental Protection promulgate legislative rule relating to voluntary remediation and redevelopment
945.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Voluntary Remediation and Redevelopment.

946.title: Authorizing State Tax Department promulgate legislative rule relating to electronic filing and payment of special district excise tax
946.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Electronic Filing and Payment of Special District Excise Tax.

947.title: Authorizing State Tax Department promulgate legislative rule relating to withholding or denial of personal income tax refunds from taxpayers who owe municipal costs, fines, forfeitures or penalties
947.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Withholding or Denial of Personal Income Tax Refunds from Taxpayers Who Owe Municipal Costs, Fines, Forfeitures or Penalties.

948.title: Authorizing State Tax Department promulgate legislative rule relating to exchange of information agreement between State Tax Division and Department of Health and Human Resources Office of Inspector General Medicaid Fraud Control Unit
948.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to an exchange of information agreement between the State Tax Division and the Department of Health and Human Resources Office of the Inspector General Medicaid Fraud Control Unit.

949.title: Authorizing Division of Tourism promulgate legislative rule relating to direct advertising grants program
949.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Tourism to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Direct Advertising Grants Program.

950.title: Authorizing Board of Veterinary Medicine promulgate legislative rule relating to schedule of fees
950.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia, 1931, as amended, relating to authorizing the Board of Veterinary Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to a Schedule of Fees.

951.title: Exempting land-based aquaculture facilities from certain sludge management requirements
951.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt land-based finfish aquaculture facilities from certain sludge management requirements.

952.title: Preserving biological evidence secured in certain criminal cases
952.description: The purpose of this bill is to preserve any biological evidence in connection with a criminal case so that the evidence is available for DNA testing when a convicted felon makes a written motion for DNA testing on the basis that the felon was not the perpetrator of the crime as provided under the DNA testing provisions of §15-2B-14 of this code.  The bill also provides a felony penalty for willful and intentional violations.

953.title: Relating to "In God We Trust" license plate
953.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue a license plate bearing the inscription "In God We Trust."

954.title: Establishing returnable beverage container deposit program
954.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a program to recycle beverage containers and reduce litter.  The bill requires the use of returnable containers for many beverages and requires the use of a ten cent deposit; exempts deposits on containers from sales taxes and excludes deposits from business and occupation taxes; prescribes the powers and duties of DEP; and prescribes penalties and remedies.

955.title: Prohibiting discrimination based upon age or sexual orientation
955.description: The purpose of this bill is to  add "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodations. This bill also provides clarification as to an exemption from the "sexual orientation" employment-based proscriptions of this bill for "religious institutions" and offers, for the purposes of this article, a definition thereof.  This bill also adds "age" and "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing. It defines "sexual orientation" as "heterosexuality, bisexuality, homosexuality or gender identity, whether actual or perceived."

956.title: Allowing majority vote for certain metro government approval
956.description: The purpose of this local bill is to permit the voters of Kanawha County to decide by majority vote in an election to decide upon a metro government and charter.

957.title: Repealing article banning nuclear power plants' construction

958.title: Creating WV Public Campaign Financing Act
958.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a system for public funding of election campaigns for candidates for the State Senate and House of Delegates who agree to and do abide by restrictions on campaign contributions from private sources and limits on campaign spending.

959.title: Relating to DUI offenses
959.description: The purpose of this bill is to  reduce recidivism of offenders convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol through mandated participation in the Motor Vehicle Alcohol Test and Lock Program for all offenders.  Implementing mandated license sanctions.  Removes expungement provisions for offenders under twenty-one years of age.  Imposition of staggered sentencing. Offender participation in community corrections programs.  Mandated guilty or nolo contendere plea in pre-trial diversion agreements. Oversight of dedicated drug and alcohol courts.

960.title: Relating to issuing general obligation bonds
960.description: The purpose of this bill is to modernize article one, chapter thirteen of the code to enable it to be consistent with the current practices and procedures required for issuing general obligation bonds through competitive sale.  The bill's updates include:  incorporating changes from section ten, article X of the West Virginia Constitution; not requiring the issuer to designate the series's of bonds in the election order; not requiring the bond resolution to set forth the date of issuance, the denominations of the bonds, the medium with which the bonds are payable or the terms of redemption; allowing issuers to establish a maximum rate of interest in the bond resolution; allowing issuers to make semiannual payments on principal and interest; increasing the time an issuer is required to begin making debt service payments from two years to three years from the date of issuance; requiring issuers to register bonds and eliminating reference to coupon bonds; allowing issuers to accept electronic bids if the issuer elects to utilize an electronic bidding procedure; and allowing an issuer to publish an abbreviated sale of notice when advertising the sale of bonds.

961.title: Relating to public employees' reemployment after retirement
961.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the ability of an elected or appointed public official to retire from his or her position, commence to receive an annuity, and continue to receive the annuity if he or she is reelected or reappointed to the same position within twelve months of retirement.

962.title: Requiring state participation in Yellow Ribbon G. I. Education Enhancement Program
962.description: The purpose of this bill is to require West Virginia public colleges and universities to participate in the federal Yellow Ribbon G.I. Education Enhancement Program ("the Program"). The Program will be established pursuant to the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008 ("the Act") to provide eligible post-9/11 veterans additional moneys towards the cost of tuition and fees at institutions of higher education.  The Act will provide educational benefits to certain post-9/11 veterans in an amount equal to the cost of in-state tuition at the most expensive public university or college in the state.  The Program will authorize the federal Secretary of Veterans Affairs to cover fifty percent of any additional costs over and above the cost of in-state tuition in exchange for a matching contribution of equal percentage from an institution of higher learning.

963.title: Relating to unemployment compensation generally
